Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Marveltest as a Data Analyst! 




About Us: At Marveltest, we’re at the forefront of data-driven business solutions. Our mission is to help businesses unlock the power of their data to drive growth and efficiency. As we continue to expand, we’re looking for a talented and motivated Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. If you’re passionate about data and love turning numbers into actionable insights, we want to hear from you!We’re looking for a Medior Data Analyst to join our team and help our clients reach the next digital level. You’ll be working with our Data Analysts, Growth Marketers, Client Managers, and Data-driven Designers to build data related products and services such as Data Warehousing and Pixel Tracking TechnologyYour Role: As a Medior Data Analyst at Marveltest, you’ll be a key player in transforming complex data into valuable business insights. Your responsibilities will include:




Data Warehousing: Manage data warehouses, focusing on data quality and validity.
Tableau Workbooks: Create and update Tableau dashboards, implementing changes based on internal and external requests.
Analytical Structures: Collaborate on designing modular and reusable analysis structures in Tableau.
Ad hoc Analyses: Conduct tailored analyses to answer business questions from both internal and external stakeholders.
Client Communication: Work closely with internal teams and clients to understand their data requirements and provide insights through dashboards and analyses.
Documentation: Maintain organized records of your analyses, ensuring they are accessible for future reference.




Collaboration within the Data Team: You’ll work closely with:

Business Analyst: Fine-tune business analyses to meet client needs.
Data Science/Engineering: Ensure seamless data flow from BigQuery to Tableau, troubleshoot issues, and improve data structure and quality.




Required Skillset:

Python: Proficient in using Python for data analysis and automation.
Excel: Comfortable with Excel, particularly for data manipulation and reporting.
Tableau (Advanced): 1+ years of experience with Tableau or a similar data visualization tool.
SQL: Strong SQL skills, with experience navigating Google BigQuery or other cloud data warehouses.
Business Acumen: Ability to connect data insights with business objectives, making recommendations that drive value.




Nice-to-Have Skills:

Data Simplification: Ability to explain complex analyses to non-data-savvy stakeholders.
Proactive Mindset: Eager to take initiative in a fast-paced startup environment.
Client Communication: Willingness to participate in client meetings and explain data insights clearly.




What do I get in return? 

Above market salary: we believe your superpowers should be well compensated.
A culture where growth, freedom, and innovation are key.
Working in an ambitious but close team: together we pull out all the stops when duty calls, but as it goes with superheroes, in real life we’re just a bunch of normal people who like to have a lot of fun together.
Help build the company: together we are always busy creating and testing new business frameworks, processes, and products.
The chance to be part of a fast-growing scale-up where you make a real impact on all clients.
The ability to work from our office in the center of Amsterdam, but also the flexibility to work from the comfort of your own home.
Bi-monthly team bonding events, weekly drinks, and daily get-togethers during (by Marveltest provided) lunch.
Your personal development is important! We have a personal budget for YOUR development.
An employee benefit to spend freely each month on a wide range of treats, powered by YourCampus.
26 paid holidays a year.
A MacBook Pro M-Chip laptop




Show more

Title: Junior Data Analist
Description:
Junior Data Analist




Ben jij een junior data-analist met een passie voor finance en data science?

Wil je je carrière starten als data-consultant en heb je een achtergrond in data science, econometrie, of een andere data-gerelateerde opleiding? Dan zijn wij bij BrightStone Group op zoek naar jou!




Wat wij zoeken:

0 tot 2 jaar werkervaring
Een opleiding in financiën of bedrijfskunde, of relevante werkervaring
Een opleiding in data science, econometrie, of een vergelijkbare richting
Bereidheid om programmeervaardigheden in Python en SQL te ontwikkelen




Wat wij bieden:

Ruime mogelijkheden voor persoonlijke en professionele groei
Coaching en begeleiding door ervaren professionals
Een werkomgeving waar jouw ideeën tellen




Ben je klaar om je passie voor finance en data science te combineren? Solliciteer dan vandaag nog!

Voor meer informatie of om te solliciteren, mail naar info@brightstonegroup.nl

Title: Data Analyst - INTERNSHIP
Description:
51,000 people. 49 countries. Over 120 office locations.

We’re not just engineers. We’re a global team of data scientists, consultants, construction workers and innovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals and resources get one step closer to solving our planet’s toughest issues. Climate change, the energy transition, digital transformation and how we can deliver a more sustainable world.?

Whatever your ambition, there’s a path for you here. And there’s no barrier to your potential career success. For more information, visit Worley.com.

About Worley

Worley has made a firm commitment to support the energy transition, and central to this is ensuring Project Delivery adheres to cost, schedule and quality and meets appropriate legislation and standards. We are rapidly expanding our capabilities within the low carbon and Energy Transition sectors and our Project Delivery team will bring experience and track record from a range of industry sectors to ensure similar standards are maintained as we assist our clients, partners, and projects in transitioning to a more sustainable world.

Our commitment to People, Planet and Sustainability is demonstrated in Worley’s broader ambitions in the energy transition space, from early-stage concept and feasibility through to delivering full EPC and EPCM packages.

Project Controls / Data Analyst Internship

We’re looking for an ambitious and intellectually curious student to join our team on an internship to learn, grow and contribute to our goal of a better tomorrow.

This will be based within our Project Controls department.

In this position, you will be requested to analyse and compare data to come to general conclusions and establish benchmarks.

The internship will have to gather information from several sources & Worley systems, bring it together, analyse & review the data and derive benchmarks which we can use internally.

There are several project controls fields in which this needs to happen:


Estimating, both professional services and capital cost: comparison of estimates against one another and comparison of estimates against actuals
We want to gain knowledge of the level of consistency between estimates (in terms of hours and cost)
We want to understand final actuals against estimates to improve future estimates
Scheduling:
Knowledge of consistency across schedules (in terms of durations)
We want to understand final actuals against baselines to improve future schedules

Important to mention is that data is not necessarily organized in a consistent way. As part of data gathering, scrutinizing data to come to comparable data sets will be very important. Therefore, having a basic understanding of engineering, estimating and scheduling and having a technical background is considered as a plus.

You will

Be working directly with project controls management team (department managers cost, estimating and scheduling and Director, project controls)

Be Involved In


Extensive data analysis
Development of benchmarks to improve quality of future estimates & schedules


Be Exposed To


Different project controls aspects, tools & systems
Detailed project knowledge in terms of cost and schedule
International working environment
Diverse & high professional teams
Opportunities to demonstrate your skill set: technical, but also communication and presentation skills


We need you to





Demonstrate excellent knowledge of excel


Demonstrate data analysis skills
Database (management) knowledge is considered a plus
Demonstrate the ability to learn quickly and pick up different tool
Demonstrate the ability to convert complex data sets into useful and easy to understand outcomes
Technical background and basic knowledge of engineering is a plus – as this will help to understand the data the need to be analysed and reviewed.
If you feel you do not meet the full criteria, we encourage you to still apply. When reviewing applications, we look at all experiences, whether that’s in-industry (paid work experience), at university (e.g. your course, society membership, events etc) or even in personal study (any experiences you have outside of university or paid employment)


What We Offer You


The opportunity to work in an international environment with very diverse teams
The opportunity to learn about the most important metrics of projects: cost & schedule
Hybrid Working (where the role allows for this)
& Much more!


Moving forward together

We want our people to be energized and empowered to drive sustainable impact. So, our focus is on a values-inspired culture that unlocks brilliance through belonging, connection and innovation.

We’re building a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace. Creating a space where everyone feels they belong, can be themselves, and are heard.

And we're not just talking about it; we're doing it. We're reskilling our people, leveraging transferable skills, and supporting the transition of our workforce to become experts in today's low carbon energy infrastructure and technology.

Whatever your ambition, there’s a path for you here. And there’s no barrier to your potential career success. Join us to broaden your horizons, explore diverse opportunities, and be part of delivering sustainable change.

Company

Worley

Primary Location

NLD-SH-The Hague

Job

Data Analysts

Schedule

Full-time

Employment Type

Employee

Job Level

Apprenticeship

Job Posting

Aug 20, 2024

Unposting Date

Sep 19, 2024

Reporting Manager Title

Senior Manager Project Controls

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job description

As a data analyst you analyse and interpret raw spectra data and convert it into useful information for the company and/or a client (project). Your main activities will be:

Collecting, checking, and structuring data.
Designing data processing algorithms that process obtained spectra into accurate material properties, such as elemental mass percentages.
Creating data models.
Drawing up reports and presentations, describing your findings.
Providing advice on the information obtained, such as material sampling strategy, measurement strategy, or measurement setup improvements.

 

Result areas

Participate in project teams that realise LIBS applications for customers, where you ensure that the target information and its accuracy requirements are reached.
Support the measurement plan and data collection for existing and new applications of our LIBS analysers.
Design, implement, and evaluate the data processing algorithms required for the application.
Monitor the accuracy and bias of our analyser applications in operation.

 

Personal qualities/competencies requirements

You have strong communication skills, are results-oriented but patient and flexible.
Broad knowledge of required software, programming languages ​​and analysis methods, such as statistical analysis, least-squares regression and curve-fitting, and machine-learning.  Knowledge of python and its analytical modules (numpy, scipy, scikit etc.) is required.
Strong analytical skills, problem-solving thinking. Combining your insight with your SW skills, you are able to swiftly select, apply, and evaluate the performance of different analysis algorithms over large datasets.  
Presentation skills and the ability to explain complex information in an understandable way.
Proactive and enterprising, contributes creative ideas for the collection or analysis of data.
Theoretical and practical knowledge of data modelling and semantics.
You have knowledge of data management and data architecture.
You have insight into and a feel for the relevant business, corporate and technical environment.
Accurate and an eye for detail.
Stress-resistant and able to deal with deadlines.
Affinity with or interest in spectral analysis.
EU passport or existing work permit for the EU.

 

Education requirements

Master (preferred) or Bachelor's degree in mathematics, physics, computer science or equivalent experience.

 

Work experience requirements

> 5 year experience in collecting, processing and analysing data, preferably in a high-tech environment.

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Red Carpet IT Services is voor een opdrachtgever op zoek naar een Data Analyst . Mocht dit een passende functie voor je zijn, dan horen we het graag!




Functie-informatie:

Je vertaalt business-doelen naar datavereisten en -toepassingen/inzichten en werkt daarbij nauw samen met zowel technische en business expertises. Je weet waar de gebruikte data vandaan komt en waar het voor gebruikt wordt en maakt daarover waar nodig afspraken met producenten en afnemers. Je hebt ervaring op het gebied van requirements, data-analyse, impact analyse, datamodellering, rapportage ontwikkeling en vind het leuk om data gedreven experimenten aan te gaan.




Functie-eisen:

Je bent naast een teamspeler ook sterk in het schrijven van queries in SQL of je hebt ervaring met een andere programmeertaal. Je bent goed in werken met Tableau en hebt frisse ideeën waar het gaat om data visualisatie. Deze ideeën kan je presenteren aan je directe collega`s en stakeholders, maar je laat ze ook realiteit worden.

Verder heb je:

Hbo/WO werk- en denkniveau
Minimaal 1-3 jaar relevante werkervaring in Data Management
Kennis en ervaring op het gebied van agile werken is een pré

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Tiqets is one of the fastest-growing tech scale-ups in the Netherlands. To keep it moving fast and making culture more accessible, we’re hiring a Data Analyst to join us!




Who are we?

We are revolutionizing the way people buy tickets to unforgettable experiences at the best destinations all over the world. Our technology makes planning easy for thousands of travelers to find all the experiences they don't want to miss during their trip (museums, zoos, theme parks, and more), so they can book all their tickets in one place.




We are an international company committed to making culture accessible to our customers and our employees. We embed diversity, equity, and inclusion into our company fiber organically.

These values are promoted from the inside out and we strive to represent and honor differences in gender, race, religion, and sexual orientation in our company culture, our content, and our product.




Our values

We are remarkable: Have fun, be creative and celebrate great moments!
We are accessible: Communicate honestly and support each other
We are adaptable: Learn, adapt, and pivot. That's who we are!




What you will do




The Data Team is responsible for supporting the data needs of many teams at Tiqets by helping them become more data-driven in how they operate. As a Data Analyst on the Data team, you will have the opportunity to work on various interesting problems related to Supply Acquisition, Supplier Portal User Analysis, A/B Testing, Reporting, Marketing Campaign Optimization, and much more.




You will work closely with Product Owners, Developers, Marketeers, and Merchandising Specialists to uncover insights about the business, build new hypotheses, and help Tiqets improve through an iterative process of testing and learning.

If you are passionate about Data, enjoy working on challenging business problems in a fast-moving environment, and believe in the importance of teamwork, this is the right opening for you.




Responsibilities




Deep dive into large business datasets to uncover valuable insights that can be turned into actionable hypotheses
Design and implement data models with SQL in DBT
Build explores and dashboards in Looker to allow others at the company to be able to ask the right data questions
Work with Product Owners, Developers, Marketeers, and Merchandising Specialists to determine and measure the right metrics in their respective domains
Keep a close eye on the ever-changing data challenges at Tiqets, and collaborate closely with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and other Data Analysts on the team to solve them
Educate and empower others at the company to be more self-reliant for their data needs
Mentor others in the team with technical guidance
Collaborate on the architectural evolution of the Tiqets data model and reporting framework




Qualifications




Technical or mathematical education at a Bachelor's or Master's level
3+ years of experience in Data Analyst roles
Experience with DBT.
Strong SQL skills; Experience working with a modern Data Warehouse like Redshift, Snowflake, or Databricks
Experience building reports on BI tools like Looker or Tableau.
Excellent oral and written communication skills; Ability to clearly explain concepts and actionable insights
Capacity to thrive in a startup/scale-up environment, adapt quickly, work independently, and take ownership of your work
Nice to have: prior experience in e-commerce with a background in hypothesis-driven A/B Testing




Perks & Benefits at Tiqets




Vibrant, dynamic, international working environment
Bright, welcoming office located in Amsterdam, 5 minutes by foot from Amstel station
Opportunity to make an impact in an award-winning tech scale-up company
20% personal Tiqets discount code for all of our products
Biweekly pizza & beer sessions to expand our knowledge with useful presentations from various team members
Friday drinks and parties to celebrate our accomplishments, our well-known annual ski trip
Pension scheme and travel compensation
Daily fresh lunch buffet provided by Join Program
Hybrid working model
Sport activities: free gym, running sessions, boot-camp, football, climbing, yoga, paddle and more
Reimbursement home workspace necessities




Get in touch!

Please send your application via the form on this vacancy. We can’t wait to hear from you!

Are you representing an agency? Thank you for your interest in our job offer. However, we are handling the recruitment process internally and do not require external assistance at this time.

Show more

As a Data Analyst on the Data team, you will have the opportunity to work on various interesting problems related to Supply Acquisition, Supplier Portal User Analysis, A/B Testing, Reporting, Marketing Campaign Optimization, and much more.


You will work closely with Product Owners, Developers, Marketeers, and Merchandising Specialists to uncover insights about the business, build new hypotheses, and help Tiqets improve through an iterative process of testing and learning.

If you are passionate about Data, enjoy working on challenging business problems in a fast-moving environment, and believe in the importance of teamwork, this is the right opening for you.


Responsibilities


  • Deep dive into large business datasets to uncover valuable insights that can be turned into actionable hypotheses
  • Design and implement data models with SQL in DBT
  • Build explores and dashboards in Looker to allow others at the company to be able to ask the right data questions
  • Work with Product Owners, Developers, Marketeers, and Merchandising Specialists to determine and measure the right metrics in their respective domains
  • Keep a close eye on the ever-changing data challenges at Tiqets, and collaborate closely with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and other Data Analysts on the team to solve them
  • Educate and empower others at the company to be more self-reliant for their data needs
  • Mentor others in the team with technical guidance
  • Collaborate on the architectural evolution of the Tiqets data model and reporting framework


Qualifications


  • Technical or mathematical education at a Bachelor's or Master's level
  • 3+ years of experience in Data Analyst roles
  • Experience with DBT.
  • Strong SQL skills; Experience working with a modern Data Warehouse like Redshift, Snowflake, or Databricks
  • Experience building reports on BI tools like Looker or Tableau.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills; Ability to clearly explain concepts and actionable insights
  • Capacity to thrive in a startup/scale-up environment, adapt quickly, work independently, and take ownership of your work
  • Nice to have: prior experience in e-commerce with a background in hypothesis-driven A/B Testing


Perks & Benefits at Tiqets


  • Vibrant, dynamic, international working environment
  • Bright, welcoming office located in Amsterdam, 5 minutes by foot from Amstel station
  • Opportunity to make an impact in an award-winning tech scale-up company
  • 20% personal Tiqets discount code for all of our products
  • Biweekly pizza & beer sessions to expand our knowledge with useful presentations from various team members
  • Friday drinks and parties to celebrate our accomplishments, our well-known annual ski trip
  • Pension scheme and travel compensation
  • Daily fresh lunch buffet provided by Join Program
  • Hybrid working model
  • Sport activities: free gym, running sessions, boot-camp, football, climbing, yoga, paddle and more
  • Reimbursement home workspace necessities


Get in touch!

Please send your application via the form on this vacancy. We can’t wait to hear from you!

Are you representing an agency? Thank you for your interest in our job offer. However, we are handling the recruitment process internally and do not require external assistance at this time.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
How do you delight our customers?

Bol continuously advances its platform to create a better tomorrow for over 13 million customers and over 50,000 trading partners. Our Advertising via bol (Avb) propositions, which help shoppers discover products and help advertisers reach shoppers, play an important role in bol’s ambitions – and this is where you’ll make the difference. As Avb Marketing, we help and engage thousands of our advertisers. Marketing Analytics plays an instrumental role here by creating building blocks for Marketing Automation. Our goal is to enable ‘Engagement at Scale’ through data by fine-tuning queries, developing data models, and ensuring that our campaigns reach the right audience at the right time.

The biggest challenge

Advertising via Bol is growing fast and becoming increasingly important for bol. The number of colleagues, the complexity of the tech, and the breadth of initiatives are rapidly expanding. Data needs and requests for more insights are no exception. At the same time, we’re implementing Marketing Automation tools to improve our capabilities. This requires us to work pragmatically and focus on achieving the required outcomes. You rise to the occasion to ensure that our data is robust, can be used effectively and responsibly and iterate quickly.

What You’ll Do As An Marketing Data Analyst

You’ll join a team of marketing data analysts in bol’s Avb Marketing Analytics team, which aims to help the marketing teams to create more engaging and impactful campaigns through data.

Your Workload Covers Three Main Areas


You build, maintain and simplify our data model – reducing complexity, making our pipelines more cost-effective and exploiting synergies between various projects. You ensure data transformations are tested, documented, monitored, performant and adhere to our security & privacy policies.
You help our marketeers by creating insights to understand customer behavior, optimize campaigns, and drive data-driven decisions. All with the goal of optimizing campaigns to help and engage advertisers.
You analyze our campaigns, all with the goal of getting a clear picture of the impact we’re making as a department.


We’re Looking For Someone Who


Can implement best practice around tools and concepts like: Git, SQL, Dbt, data testing, monitoring, and alerting, to create a state-of-the-art analytics environment that enforces quality standards.
Uses their strong communication skills to bridge the gap between Marketeers, Analysts and Product Engineers.
Doesn’t want to work alone. You help model pipelines, optimize queries, and apply best practices. You also actively collaborate within bol’s wider analytics engineering and data engineering community to improve our data stack at scale.
Practices and preaches Clean Code principles such as DRY and Clean, Clear and Concise.


3 reasons why this is (not) for you Switch to find out


No, if you’re uncomfortable with ambiguity Our data landscape evolves, and you’ll need to navigate it confidently. The complexity of our organization requires you to pro-actively involve colleagues throughout our Product & Tech organization to find solutions.
No, if you prefer output over outcome If your work ends when you complete a feature – who cares how users experience it – than this job is not for you. You’re looking to find real solutions for our marketing teams to build solid campaigns.
No, if you’re not interested in continuous improvement We’re always learning from our analyses and work to improve our ways-of-working.
Yes, if you’ve built up hands-on experience in analytics and love to share it If you have 5+ relevant experience in marketing analytics (as a data analyst, advanced analyst, or related role) and like to share your knowledge and experience with others. Experience with data engineering, analytics engineering or business intelligence engineering or experience with marketing automation tooling (such as Marigold Engage) is a plus.
Yes, if you produce high quality code & data Yes, if you have a deep interest in analytics and get excited by finetuning queries, data models, and coding principles. SQL and Git are your home away from home. Experience with Dbt is a plus.
Yes, if you can translate data to opportunity and opportunity to campaign building block Our role is multi-faceted so you’re not a one trick pony. It starts with extracting campaign opportunities from data and ends with realizing the data foundation for scalable marketing campaigns.


This is where you’ll work

You’ll join a team of four Marketing Data Analysts which supports our broader Avb Marketing team. Sparring with strategic and communication oriented marketeers happens on a daily basis. We work in collaborative spaces where you’ll work alongside other data enthusiasts, enjoying a mix of open areas and quiet corners. Our most important stakeholders in Marketing, Sales and Product are just a stroll away.

It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.
Show more

It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.

Title: Commercial Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

This is B&S

B&S exists to make premium consumer goods available to everyone, anywhere. We believe that getting access to consumer products that bring joy and comfort into everyday lives, should be easy around the globe.

We are proud to see B&S featured in the latest edition of the #MT500 by MT/Sprout, which lists the 500 most reputable companies in the Netherlands. We rank #9 most attractive employer and #6 most sustainable company.

Are you curious about who we are as an employer and our thoughts on diversity and inclusion?Click here to find more information!

Job Description

Are you ready to give your career a flying start? As a Data Analyst, you’re not afraid to take the lead, you quickly master systems, and you have a keen eye for detail. This is your chance to develop and challenge yourself while playing a crucial role in the development of our procurement applications. Together, as a team, we continuously improve and streamline our processes. Are you ready to take the initiative?

Reach your full potential as a Data Analyst

The first year is all about learning and growing. You will get to know our company, our suppliers, and our processes by working with the support team. This will give you a good understanding of how we handle our orders and how purchase orders are created. In addition, you will join all developments related to our procurement application.

Our current application is used extensively by our buyers, but we see room for improvement. This is where you come in:


With support from the manager and your new colleagues, you will bring new and existing projects to fruition
Besides this, you implement them with current users, and become a key-user for the procurement application.
In addition, you collect and interpret information from these purchasing applications, such as quotes, supplier performance and other internal or external sources. In this role, you take charge of your own procurement and move within set frameworks, giving you the space to make decisions independently.


You measure your success by controlling the daily procurement processes, ensuring both quality and quantity. Based on existing deadlines and objectives for the projects, you try to complete them on time or inform the stakeholders of any delays.

Qualifications

This Is You

You have a sharp analytical mind and are incredibly quick at processing and analysing commercial data. Additionally, you are a pro at deciphering and automating complex systems and processes. With your keen eye, no detail escapes you. You take the lead in projects with great enthusiasm and ensure smooth coordination with all involved.

You


Have a bachelor's degree in a data-related field
Have affinity for data visualization
Are proficientin using data analysis tools and software


Additional Information

We offer you


A maximum salary ofup to €2800,- in line with your experience, plus a yearly fixed Christmas gratuityand a performance dependent bonus
Initially, a one-year contract with the prospect of permanent employment
25 vacation days, with the possibility to purchase additional days
A travel allowance of up to 75 km on single trip travel when working at the office, or an allowance if you’re working remotely (from home)
The flexibility to work 1 day a week from home
A pension scheme where 2/3rd of the pension costs are paid by us
The possibility to take courses related to your growth ambitions and function
A coaching program focused on your mental health (non-binding)
Participation in group insurance such as disability insurance and survivor’s insurance
Free use of our company gym and possibility to purchase fresh meals at our company restaurant
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
(Fulltime, 38hrs per week)

About The Job

Do you want to work for a highly successful, fast expanding international retailer with many growth opportunities? At Action we offer you the opportunity to become part of our newly created Strategy and Analytics team as Data Analyst and play an important role in supporting the overall growth of Action.

This is your daily action

The Data Analyst is part of the Business Development Team and reports to the Head of Business Development. Together with senior executives, the Strategy and Analytics team works on key topics for Action such as: Sustainability, Digitization, Expansion, Supply Chain and more. Together with your team members you support in driving data-driven decision-making across the organization.

Your work field is very dynamic, but in general involves tasks such as:


Build deep insights and analysis regarding the dynamic and competitive landscape in which we operate.
Work with our internal data and external market data to discover insights, converting these into tangible business recommendations that support our strategy.
Lead and participate in strategic projects, in close collaboration with your colleagues from the Strategy and Analytics Team and the Action team at large.
Support operational departments in root cause analyses and understanding performance issues


Your work location will be our International Head Office in Zwaagdijk (a 30 minutes traffic free drive from Amsterdam).

This is you

What you bring:


Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Familiarity with retail analytics, including sales forecasting, inventory, and customer behavior analysis.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in data analysis or a related field.
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.


What we offer

Surprisingly much! From our international headquarters in the Netherlands you have an impact on what happens in our stores across Europe. We welcome more than 15 million customers every week in more than 2,600 stores in 12 European countries. We have great growth ambitions. For Action and for you. Because our growth means that you can always take new steps. A different position, an interesting innovation project, new skills: you can continue to develop as a professional. And all this in a culture where our shared values are truly lived: customer focus, teamwork, simplicity, discipline, cost conscious and respect

Did you know that you can also count on us for:


A competitive salary based on a 38-hour working week
24 paid vacation days with the option of purchasing 5 extra days (based on 38 hours per week).
A temporary contract with the intention of offering you a permanent contract in the long term
Flexible working hours
15% employee discount on your purchases at Action
A good pension scheme and collective health insurance


How we contribute to society

If you only know Action from the stores, a world will open up for you when you come and work with us. We work hard to make a positive impact on society and the environment. Did you know, for example, that we sponsor more than 2,500 children worldwide who grow up in an SOS Children's Village? That our team reflects the diversity of our customers, including 155 different nationalities? That we purchase 94% of our wood products and 100% of our cotton sustainably? And that almost all our stores only use energy-efficient LED lighting? Yes, that is also Action. Curious about what other initiatives we’re facilitating? Join our team and find out for yourself.

Interested?

Take action and apply now!

The next steps


Our recruiter will review your application and get back to you as soon as possible.
We invite you for a first job interview.
We would like to get to know you better, which is why we ask you to take an online assessment.
We will invite you for a second interview and we will discuss your assessment.
Are we still a great match? Then we will become new colleagues!


At Action, integrity is of great importance to us. A pre-employment screening is therefore part of the application process for this vacancy. Contact your recruiter for more information.
Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
HTML:
Are you looking for a job in data analytics and do you have an affinity with the real estate market? Then this is an unique opportunity to combine your analytical skills with a substantive function in a commercial environment!


What will you be doing?

The real estate market is undergoing a significant and exciting change – driven by data and technology. The main focus of this position will be analyzing European Commercial Real Estate data across all sectors. The role includes responsibility over the Enterprise Data Platform for Continental Europe, and will encompass internal and external reporting on the back of this. The role will establish a profound relationship with the local research teams as well as provide support to the global research platform.


Your key responsibilities:

  • Liaise with national CBRE research teams to gather statistics and commentaries on European Commercial Real Estate markets;
  • Conduct deep-dive analysis on incoming queries regarding business challenges or opportunities;
  • Prepare regular and quarterly management- and research reports for internal and external purposes and further enhancement of these;
  • Review and evaluate collected European data and securing data quality, consistency, accuracy and comprehensiveness;
  • Automate manual tasks and reports by making intelligent use of available ETL and dashboarding software;
  • Collaborate with Digital & Technology and Customer success teams on improving platforms and data products.


What can you offer us?

  • You are a recent graduate with a bachelor's degree in Real Estate, Economics, Finance, Data Analytics or related disciplines;
  • You have up to 1 year of relevant international (European) professional experience in an analytically oriented, data, or quantitative role;
  • You have basic knowledge of some of the following technologies; Alteryx, SQL, Python, R, relational database concepts, and an intrinsic motivation to develop these skills;
  • You have basic knowledge of reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI and enjoy converting data into valuable insights;
  • You have strong numerical skills including the ability to handle and manipulate large amounts of numerical data into clearly defined outputs based on a project driven approach;
  • You think in terms of optimism, opportunities and innovation;
  • You have an excellent understanding of the English language considering the majority of your tasks, but the Dutch language comes in handy;
  • You are based in The Netherlands.

What can we offer you?

At CBRE you will work with all kinds of specialists to provide a thorough advice. Professionals with a commercial, financial, architectural and even creative background and all with the same drive for real estate.


We can also offer you as (young) professional extensive opportunities to develop your managerial qualities on the one hand, while on the other hand evolving as specialist (thought leadership) through our collective training program, the CBRE Academy, but also via individual coaching opportunities. Hereby providing you with the opportunity to create an added value for our company but also for your own career.


Additionally, we offer you:

  • A monthly base salary between €2.800,- and €3.500,-, supplemented by an attractive bonus scheme;
  • Nearly premium-free pension;
  • Reimbursement of travel expenses for public transport, car, and bicycle;
  • A laptop and iPhone;
  • 25 vacation days per year based on 40 hours + 3 extra vacation days designated by our board and the option to purchase 5 additional vacation days per year. In addition, you can exchange religious holidays for ones that are more meaningful to you;
  • Accrual of holiday allowance of 8% of your gross annual salary;
  • The option to work remotely for 2 weeks;
  • Additional benefits include, among others, a favorable bicycle scheme and the ability to work remotely for 2 weeks. We also refund up to €600,- a year for any sports activities our employees undertake.


What will your team look like?

You will work in a hybrid team of central and in-country Data and Business Intelligence analysts and report directly to one of the European Data analysts. In the team we work together with colleagues from other countries, departments and clients of CBRE.


Who is your new employer?

CBRE is an organization where it does not matter if you are an experienced professional or a young talent or which position you hold. We offer everyone the freedom to identify and seize opportunities. We work hard for our successes and also celebrate these with each other, for example, after closing a deal of during our weekly drinks.


With over 90,000 employees spread over 450+ offices in 100 countries, CBRE is global market leader in real estate consultancy. In the Netherlands our 600+ professionals work each day on the most exciting real estate projects from our offices in Amsterdam, The Hague, Eindhoven, Rotterdam, Utrecht and Zwolle.


Since the beginning of 2019, CBRE has a new headquarters in the Schinkelbuurt in Amsterdam, named The Core. A new, innovative office under a 50-year-old roof in an old car garage. With this office we take a new path, we give entrepreneurship the space it needs, and we work closer together with our clients.


Do you want a real career in real estate?

Please click the button on the top right and submit your cv and a cover letter. Within two weeks you will receive a response. Any questions? Feel free to send an email to our Recruitment Team at nlrecruitment@cbre.com .

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
LocationUtrecht , NetherlandsBusiness SectorAIContact emailJob ref23549Published20 days ago

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join one of our clients in MedTech. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets, generating reports, and providing data-driven recommendations to support our healthcare initiatives.

Responsibilities


Analyze healthcare data to generate insights that drive clinical and business decisions.
Create reports and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Collaborate with data scientists, engineers, and clinicians to ensure data accuracy and relevance.
Ensure compliance with healthcare data standards and regulations.
Contribute to continuous improvement of data processes and systems.



Qualifications


Proven experience as a Data Analyst, ideally within the healthcare or MedTech sector.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, and data visualization platforms (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Experience working with healthcare data and knowledge of healthcare data standards.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication skills with the ability to present data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Professional proficiency in English.



Can this be interesting for you or anyone you know? If so, please send Gabriel Andrade: g.andrade@panda-int.com, your number/CV ASAP and I'll give you a call. Interviews will start next week.

Position: Data Analyst

Contract: FT

Location: Utrecht

Start Date: Immediately or by agreement
Show more
HTML:
LocationUtrecht , NetherlandsBusiness SectorAIContact emailJob ref23549Published20 days ago

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join one of our clients in MedTech. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets, generating reports, and providing data-driven recommendations to support our healthcare initiatives.

Responsibilities

  • Analyze healthcare data to generate insights that drive clinical and business decisions.
  • Create reports and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with data scientists, engineers, and clinicians to ensure data accuracy and relevance.
  • Ensure compliance with healthcare data standards and regulations.
  • Contribute to continuous improvement of data processes and systems.


Qualifications

  • Proven experience as a Data Analyst, ideally within the healthcare or MedTech sector.
  • Strong proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, and data visualization platforms (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
  • Experience working with healthcare data and knowledge of healthcare data standards.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to present data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Professional proficiency in English.


Can this be interesting for you or anyone you know? If so, please send Gabriel Andrade: g.andrade@panda-int.com, your number/CV ASAP and I'll give you a call. Interviews will start next week.

Position: Data Analyst

Contract: FT

Location: Utrecht

Start Date: Immediately or by agreement

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Een baan als Data Analist bij Digital Power

Als Data Analist bij Digital Power help je verschillende organisaties om beslissingen te maken op basis van data. Het is jouw taak om complexe informatie vanuit verschillende domeinen te vertalen in heldere en concrete actiepunten. Jouw doel is om ervoor te zorgen dat beslissingen niet meer worden genomen ‘op onderbuikgevoel’ maar op basis van feitelijke data.




Je werkt in multi-disciplinaire teams met collega’s van Digital Power en/of klantteams. Wij vinden het belangrijk om kennis met elkaar te delen. Hierdoor ontwikkel jij je razendsnel. Maar we verwachten ook een actieve bijdrage van jou! Dit doe je op je eigen manier, bijvoorbeeld door training te geven of junior collega’s te coachen.




Naast je opdracht(en) maak je deel uit van onze interne community. Leer van, en mét je collega’s en help elkaar nóg beter te worden! Kom je ergens niet uit? Dan staat ons hele team voor je klaar.




Wie we zoeken

Passie voor data

Je duikt graag in de off- én online data van organisaties
Je krijgt energie van het omzetten van data naar bruikbare inzichten
Je kunt data helder analyseren, visualiseren en uitleggen




De nodige ervaring

Je hebt minimaal 1 jaar werkervaring als Data Analist
Je hebt ervaring met visualisatietools zoals PowerBI of Tableau en/of (web)analyse tools zoals Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics
Je bent communicatief vaardig en in staat om organisaties te helpen meer datagedreven te werken




What else?

Je vindt het leuk om bij verschillende opdrachtgevers aan de slag te gaan: van NGO's tot aan marketingbureaus en van banken tot aan overheidsinstanties
Ervaring met SQL is een pré
Je bent leergierig en altijd bezig met je eigen ontwikkeling
Je denkt na over wat de vraag áchter de vraag is
Je vindt een goede sfeer op je werk nét zo belangrijk als je vak
Je krijgt goede energie van onze ‘werken bij’ pagina
Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal goed in woord en geschrift
Een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding




Wat we bieden

We bieden een startsalaris van € 2800 – € 6500 bruto per maand, afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring.

Onbeperkt opleidingsbudget en je eigen werktijden indelen: kijk hier wat we je nog meer allemaal bieden.

Title: Medior Data Analist
Description:
Medior Data Analist




Ben jij een ervaren data analist met een bewezen track record in de financiële sector? Heb je een passie voor het aanpakken van complexe datavraagstukken en beschik je over sterke stakeholder management skills? Wij bij Brightstone Group zoeken een Medior Data Analist die klaar is voor de volgende stap in zijn/haar carrière.




Wat wij zoeken:

5+ jaar ervaring binnen banken of de financiële sector
Uitgebreide kennis van credit risk of andere risicoanalyses
Ervaring met stakeholder management
Vaardig in Python en SQL




Wat wij bieden:

Uitdagende en impactvolle projecten binnen toonaangevende financiële instellingen
Een rol waarin jouw expertise en inzichten cruciaal zijn voor succes
Mogelijkheden om je verder te specialiseren en door te groeien
Een collegiale en professionele werkomgeving




Als jij klaar bent om je carrière naar een hoger niveau te tillen en complexe datavraagstukken aan te pakken, dan nodigen wij je uit om te solliciteren.




Voor meer informatie of om te solliciteren, mail naar info@brightstonegroup.nl.

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Word jij onze nieuwe enthousiaste BI-engineer/consultant voor Zig | Insights?




Voor het onboarden en begeleiden van nieuwe klanten op ons BI-platform Zig | Insights zijn wij op zoek naar een enthousiaste BI-engineer/consultant.

Geloof jij net als wij dat de impact van data op organisaties steeds belangrijker wordt voor het vaststellen én behalen van doelstellingen en het maken van strategische keuzes? Wil jij met data een verschil maken, onder andere voor de maatschappelijke doelstellingen van onze klanten en hun klanten? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!




Wat ga je doen

Jij speelt een belangrijke rol in het aansluiten van nieuwe klanten op ons BI-platform en het vertalen van hun wensen naar bestaande standaarden of refinements voor nieuwe standaarden. Samen met je collega’s en de klanten blijf je nieuwe informatieproducten ontwikkelen, zoals KPI’s en visualisaties in Fabric/PowerBI. Met het team (22 collega’s) optimaliseer je continu het platform met innovaties en nieuwe functionaliteiten.




Als BI-engineer/consultant ben je dagelijks bezig om samen met de klant het maximale uit de samenwerking en het BI-platform te halen. Een aantal taken en verantwoordelijkheden die bij jouw rol horen zijn:




Het onboarden van nieuwe klanten op het Zig | Insights platform.
Het begeleiden van het projectteam bij de klant in het begrijpen en integreren van definities/indicatoren vanuit de informatieproducten in de organisatieprocessen.
Het begeleiden van de dagstart- en dageinde-sessies met de klant en het beheer van de backlog; samen met de projectleider de voortgang bewaken.
Analyseren en implementeren van oplossingen om klanten te helpen bij het analyseren en rapporteren van hun data, met als doel inzicht te verkrijgen in de bedrijfsprocessen en betere datagedreven strategische beslissingen te nemen.
Analyseren en uitwerken van de informatiebehoefte van klanten op een duidelijke en gestructureerde manier, en deze behoeften vertalen naar gedetailleerde specificaties om oplossingen te ontwikkelen die aansluiten bij de behoeften van de klanten.
Het ontzorgen van de klant in het proces van data ontsluiting, data preparatie en het bouwen aan integrale informatievoorziening.
Fungeren als interne specialist op het gebied van business intelligence, waarbij je voortdurend de nieuwste ontwikkelingen en trends binnen dit vakgebied volgt om je deskundigheid te maximaliseren.




Dit ben jij

Jij vindt het leuk om in een team te werken dat een sterke visie heeft om de vastgoedsector via data te professionaliseren. Je hebt een passie voor data en wilt deze graag delen met klanten. Je wilt hen helpen om meer datagedreven te werken en te groeien naar een datagedreven organisatie. Jij kunt de vertaalslag maken van klantvragen naar te ontwikkelen indicatoren en dashboards.




Als BI-engineer/consultant beschik je over de volgende kennis en ervaring:

HBO- of WO-werk- en denkniveau (bij voorkeur in de richting bedrijfskunde, informatica, data science of toegepaste wiskunde)
Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring in de richting van Business Intelligence en/of data analytics
Ervaring met data-visualisatie-tooling (bijvoorbeeld Power BI)
Sterke analytische en communicatieve vaardigheden
Vloeiend in Nederlands, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk




Een dikke pré is als je een achtergrond of kennis hebt in finance en/of goed bent in het overzien van processen.




Wat is Zig | Insights?

Zig Insights is hét innovatieve BI-platform voor de vastgoedsector. We begeleiden organisaties bij het verwerken van data tot waardevolle informatie, op een eenduidige en gestructureerde manier, waarbij we de standaarden van de sector gebruiken. Het BI-team van Zig helpt klanten met de stappen die nodig zijn om een datagedreven cultuur te creëren.




Onze dataspecialisten hebben de drive en ambitie om zichzelf steeds opnieuw uit te vinden en werken continu aan het verbeteren en optimaliseren van producten en diensten. Samen maken we mooie dingen. De collega’s binnen het team zijn een beetje eigenwijs, hebben humor, maar houden altijd de focus op het resultaat van de klant.




Wie zijn wij?

Wij zijn Zig. We ontwikkelen software voor de vastgoedbranche (woningcorporaties, studentenhuisvesters en commercieel vastgoed) en doen dit met veel plezier.




Wij helpen organisaties om dichter bij hun klanten te komen met slimme processen, innovatieve technologieën en data. Onze digitale oplossingen zorgen ervoor dat de focus op de klant zichtbaar en voelbaar is in het complete proces: van een woning zoeken en vinden tot aan bewonen en verhuizen. Wij maken wonen makkelijker.




Dit doen wij al meer dan 14 jaar met een enthousiast team van ruim 300 specialisten die werken in Huizen, Veenendaal en hybride. Meer dan 160 vastgoedorganisaties en 1,6 miljoen mensen maken gebruik van onze software.




Dit krijg je ervoor terug




Wij bespreken graag jouw salariswens tijdens onze eerste kennismaking. Het salaris ligt tussen de € 4500 en € 5500 op basis van een 40-urige werkweek, afhankelijk van jouw kennis en ervaring.
Ruimte om mee te denken over de doorontwikkeling van onze producten en jouw kennis te delen;
Ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen via de Zig Academy;
Werken bij een 'Great place to work', een bedrijf met ambitie en een sterke visie;
Een fijne sfeer binnen een organisatie die altijd in beweging is;
De mogelijkheid om je werkplek en -tijd flexibel in te delen;
26 vakantiedagen (bij een fulltime dienstverband);
Een goede pensioenregeling;
Samenwerken met 300 gemotiveerde en gedreven collega’s, ze vertellen je graag waarom Zig de juiste keuze is.




Overtuigd? Laat het ons weten!

Ben jij ervan overtuigd dat jij goed past bij de functie en bij ons als organisatie? Dan is het tijd om in actie te komen. Wacht dan niet langer en solliciteer direct met je LinkedIn profiel.




Wil je eerst meer informatie voordat je solliciteert? Geen probleem. Je kunt altijd contact opnemen met Saskia Kronenburg, onze recruiter bij Zig. Ze is telefonisch of via WhatsApp bereikbaar op 06-41611022.

Show more

Title: Customer Intelligence Analyst
Description:
RetailSonar is a fast-growing SAAS company specializing in geomarketing for large retail and service companies. RetailSonar has offices already in 4 countries (Belgium, The Netherlands, France, Germany) and is technologically readiness for further scaling up toward European market leadership. Therefore we are looking for a Customer Intelligence Analyst to join our colleagues in the Dutch office in Utrecht.




Our unique RetailSonar platform is fed by state of the art AI technology and up-to-date marketdata, which is the base of our very accurate performance prediction.

RetailSonar is looking for suitable Dutch candidates to join its existing team of Customer Intelligence Analysts.




Your future colleagues have a great affinity with big data, data processing and predictive modelling. Our employees are true multitaskers: they work simultaneously on multiple projects at major retailers and service providers.




Your responsibilities:

Your daily tasks include validating and analysing customer data, platform configuration and building powerful predictive models.
You maintain frequent contact with the customers you work for.
Customer satisfaction is our number one priority. We achieve this by delivering high-quality end results and going the extra mile. Our analysts rise to any challenge and dare to think out-of-the-box.




Moreover, our employees are real team players: together, they always succeed in communicating the most important conclusions and insights to the client in a structured manner. Constructive feedback is important to us and we help each other to get the best out of ourselves. Every day again!




About you:

Preferably, you hold an master's degree in technical/economical or business area which is complemented by a master's degree in data technology (e.g. Data Science, Data Analytics, Business Informatics)
A first experience in a data driven position is a strong plus
You have a sharp, analytical mind
You have a passion for data processing (SQL, Excel, Access, SAS, ...)
You have enough courage, enthusiasm, persuasiveness and a corresponding language skill (NL-EN) to speak to the highest management at our (international) customers
A strong backbone that enables you to transform stressful situations into positive energy
A real team player who can also work well independently




What we have to offer:




A varied position with a steep and challenging learning curve in a particularly innovative and extremely exciting field within retail: geomarketing & customer intelligence.
A competitive salary package that is topped off every semester by a team bonus and individual bonus that encourage you to get the most out of yourself and your team.
The opportunity to be part of a young, close-knit and highly driven international team that enthusiastically builds successful, ground-breaking solutions.
A committed and personal organisation that values a good work-life balance.
A very personal coaching program that offers you ample opportunity to further explore your own interests.
The opportunity to work with executives and experts from the largest retail companies and governments. The ideal way to broaden your world.
Regular team events and trips to Belgium and beyond.

Title: Commercial Data & Reporting analyst
Description:
Commercial Data and Reporting Analyst (m/f/d)

Scope of Position:

The sales operations team drives sales efficiency globally, through metrics, training, CRM and cross functional alignment. Within this team, the role of the Commercial Data and Reporting Analyst is to serve as a bridge connecting internal/external customers with business related reports and information. Comfortable utilizing performance excellence tools, they also bridge the gap between business needs and technology solutions. Their primary focus is on leveraging PBI, Salesforce and other sales and reporting technologies to optimize and streamline business processes. They are playing an active role in transforming some of our current manual operation tools into automatic IT solutions. They should have a strong subject matter understanding of commercial operations processes, tools, and systems.

Day to Day Responsibilities:

Sales Incentive Plan processes
Administer sales incentive programs
Manage the day-to-day administration of sales incentive programs
This includes tracking performance metrics and ensuring that incentive data is accurate and up to date
Develop and maintain tools to drive annual budget cycle
Monthly build of data cube for SIP processing
Collaborate with Commercial Reporting team and Sales managers to identify new customers and update mapping files
Support quarterly transfer meeting with Sales managers and load subsequent, approved corrections
Coordinate escalations as required to resolve unapproved correction requests
Support quarterly reviews with Sales Leadership, HR, and Finance to share performance results and deeper analyses such as observed trends, themes, and potential focus areas that may lead to future plan optimization
Capture, troubleshoot, report out and correct any errors identified by sales managers
Provide training and support to the Commercial team on the use of IT Sales Incentive Planning systems
Collaborate with IT and the data analytics team to ensure the accuracy and integrity of sales data. Sales intelligence
Develop, manage, and communicate reporting and analytics critical to the commercial organization
Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams, translating business requirements into technical specifications
Work together with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and IT professionals to gather, analyze, and document business requirements, ensuring the successful implementation and enhancement of solutions
Act as the subject matter expert for sales technology platforms, providing guidance and best practices to ensure optimal system performance and data integrity
Identifies gaps and provides technical expertise in business requirements for system functional specifications and scales new and current systems, processes, and procedures in a cost-effective manner

Education and experience requirement:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Management of Information Systems, Systems Engineering
Technical education and experience in query tools, data compilation and manipulation for trend analysis and suggested solutions
3-5 years Data Analytics experience
Knowledge and experience with sales and sales processes (inclusive of Sales Incentive Plans)
Knowledge of CRM systems, ERP systems, and other sales-related software
Familiarity with Agile and Scrum methodologies
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills (customer focused, enabling, engaging)
Ability to work/build relationships in an international multi-cultural matrix organization
Results oriented, detailed oriented, rigorous, forward looking
Excellent analytical skills
Advanced knowledge of PowerBI, Power Query functionality and Excel




Travel Requirements: Minimal travel required

Hours of work/work schedule/flex-time: Monday – Friday (40 hours/week)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The job

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in making data accessible and understandable across the company. Your key responsibilities will include:


Developing and managing dashboards and analyses to support strategic business initiatives using PowerBI and Databricks.
Conducting exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Collaborating with internal stakeholders to understand their data needs and translating these into impactful solutions.
Contributing to cross-functional projects and initiatives within the Network team.
Ensuring data quality by working with data engineers to establish custom data quality rules and validations.
Leading projects and mentoring junior team members to foster continuous learning and improvement.



Who We’re Looking For:


You hold an MSc in mathematics, econometrics, statistics, data science, or a related field.
You have at least 5 years of experience in data analysis, with proficiency in SQL and hands-on experience with Databricks and PowerBI.
You possess strong analytical, strategic, and storytelling skills, with the ability to communicate complex data effectively.
You excel in building relationships and working collaboratively with stakeholders at all levels.
Experience with Dynamics 365 CRM and knowledge in logistics, navigation, or fleet management is a plus.
You are eager to immerse yourself in the electric trucking market, with a strong alignment to our values: reliability, sustainability, approachability, progressiveness, and a fast-paced work ethic.
Fluency in English is required; additional European languages are advantageous.



What We Offer:


The chance to join a purpose-driven company at a pivotal moment, with opportunities to shape our future.
A dynamic and supportive work environment with ample room for personal growth and development.
Comprehensive benefits, including a pension plan, unlimited vacation days, and flexible (hybrid) working arrangements.



Ready to Join Us? If you are passionate about shaping the future of sustainable transport and meet the above criteria, we encourage you to apply. Please submit your resumé in English. At Milence, we value diversity and welcome applicants from all backgrounds.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
You and Your Job

As a Data Analyst you are the primary contact with our stakeholders, which are mostly consumers of the data in your data warehouse. You guide consumers in the usage of the data, validate new requirements of the business stakeholders and guide the (IT-) implementation of new initiatives. The Data Analyst represents customer and end-user concerns by gathering input from stakeholders to understand the problem to be solved. You may also help to identify potential areas of automation and support or advise the business in re-engineering the underlying business process.

Practical examples

  • You will take responsibility for data elements for their end-to-end usage across the enterprise;
  • You will work closely with the Product Owner and help to set the right priorities;
  • You do not involve just a single role but include a network of people with accountabilities for ensuring that all aspects of an effective data environment are being accomplished;
  • You will tackle various data related issues and you will work on global and cross functional change projects to improve our processes and systems;
  • You ensure that Data Management topics are included in the backlog; such as data definitions, dq monitoring, data lineage, etc

Top Responsibilities

  • You monitor and validate the data provided by your data warehouse, whilst ensuring on BCBS239 compliancy and data lineage;
  • You will work closely with a business analyst to translate requirements into business rules for the decommissioning of our legacy systems and migrating towards the cloud;
  • You ensure that data elements and definitions are suited for internal and external reports;
  • You analyse the impact of Basel IV on the Critical Data Elements;
  • You define data requirements and give input to project scope/objectives through research, fact finding and elicitation with a solid understanding of business, systems, and requirements. You will participate in testing of changes against requirements and you develop knowledge of business analysis and business requirements;
  • You participate (reporting) in the run process;
  • You represent the department and your team and act as a liaison between regulator and/or business needs, and the actual data. So you work with business users to ensure they can understand the data model and can use it to meet their needs.

Together we achieve more than alone

Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. Our team brings talented people together from various nationalities and backgrounds. As our colleague you will tackle various data related issues and play a role in global and cross domain efforts to improve our processes and systems.

We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So we are very curious about what you can bring to our team within Chapter Data.

Joris, Data Analyst: “Working as a Data Analyst for our teams in on our new data warehousing means working with data in an international environment during a large strategic transition. This involves the implementation of regulatory requirements, adherence to compliance and data management standards. Next to that accurately and timely processing of the data is key for meeting the reporting deadlines of our stakeholders.”

Our chapter brings a diverse, talented group of people to manage and develop the financial data platform of Rabobank. Working together is the way we work; as 1 data-minded team at Rabobank.

Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,5000,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.

You and your talent

  • Preferable a Master degree in Economics, Finance, Business Administration or a related (quantitative) field;
  • You have 2+ years of relevant banking experience within the financial industries sector;
  • You have strong analytical and conceptual skills (databases, data warehouses and SQL);
  • You have knowledge of databases, data warehouses and SQL;
  • You have strong communication skills in English, both spoken and written.

This Is What We Offer You

  • A gross salary between € 4.292,- and € 6.130,- (scale 9) depending on experience;
  • 36 hours per week as standard;
  • Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance;
  • Employment Benefit Budget of 11% of your gross salary to be used at your discretion;
  • Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out;
  • A pension scheme to which you contribute 5.5% or 3.5%.

This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Data Analyst based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.

You and the job application process

We look forward to your response to the vacancy of Data Analyst at Rabobank.

  • Any questions about the job content? Contact: Müberra Oral, Chapter Lead via muberra.oral@rabobank.nl. Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact: Riken Louridtz, Recruiter via riken.louridtz@rabobank.nl
  • You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/nl/veelgestelde-vragen.
  • A security check is part of the process.
  • We respect your privacy.

#dataanalyst #rabobank

Title: Junior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Title

Junior Business Intelligence Analyst

Job Description Summary

As a Business Intelligence Analyst for our Netherlands business, you will be a pivotal member of the Netherlands dedicated BI team, focused on local delivery and transforming Netherlands analytics offerings. Collaborating closely with local teams and leadership, you will leverage data to drive insights, enhance client value, and propel our business operations forward. Working in tandem with a locally focused data operations team, your role is nested within the larger EMEA Analytics team, ensuring synergy with a wide array of talent including data scientists and automation specialists. You will specialize in analyzing and interpreting data, providing actionable insights to inform strategic decisions for both our clients & internal operations. Your exceptional analytical skills, combined with a deep understanding of BI tools, will enable you to visualize and communicate complex data effectively. This high-visibility role is not just about analyzing numbers, it's about being at the heart of innovation and playing a key role in driving significant, positive change across our organization.

Please send your CV in English.

Job Description

Responsibilities:


Collaborate with clients and internal stakeholders to deliver market, client, and operational intelligence.
Serve as the client's advocate, translating their needs and feedback into actionable insights.
Simplify and present complex data clearly to diverse audiences, ensuring understanding across all client types and levels of leadership.
Convert strategic business inquiries into actionable insights by actively seeking out and defining necessary analytics resources and requirements.
Create prototype solutions such as reports and dashboards to visually represent complex data sets and support insight generation.
Partner closely with wider EMEA Analytics Team to ensure the maximum value and best outcome is achieved.
Deliver on the KPIs assigned to you that align with business goals, supported by a solid analytical framework.
Facilitate communication between business units and Analytics teams to clearly define project objectives, business needs, and timelines, enhancing data organization, innovation, and optimization.


Requirements:


Fluency in both English and Dutch is required.
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Real Estate or Technology.
Common MS Office applications to excellent levels including SharePoint and OneDrive.
Min. 1 years of experience in Power BI (or any other data visualization tool e.g. Tableau)
Great attention to detail, diligent and focused.
Committed, able to work to deadlines, prioritise and juggle between tasks.
Business writing and reporting skills
Thoughtful, collaborative, and proactive ready to engage with stakeholders across the globe.
Ability to build & maintain effective working relationships with internal and external personnel.
Demonstrate flexibility and ability to deliver.
Good team player, also able to work independently.
Curiosity and drive to solve problems.
Experience with SQL is preferred
Experience with Databricks and/ or Azure is preferred
Eager to learn


What Do We Offer:


An informal working atmosphere in which you work together with enthusiastic and inspiring colleagues with years of experience in commercial real estate;
Plenty of room for own initiatives, a lot of independence and responsibility plus various growth opportunities;
A pleasant workplace in a modern office in the Amsterdam Zuidas area;
Hybrid working model;
Good secondary benefits including 31 days of leave, laptop and iPhone, holiday pay, bonus scheme, pension scheme, employer's contribution to group health insurance and company fitness;
Cozy company and team outings!

Title: Data Analyst/Market Researcher
Description:
Job Description

Responsibilities:


Conduct in-depth market research to identify industry trends, competitive landscapes, and growth opportunities.
Collect, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights and inform business decisions.
Develop and maintain comprehensive databases and dashboards to track key performance indicators and metrics.
Generate reports, presentations, and visualizations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop strategies and initiatives based on research findings.
Stay current on market developments, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analysis and market research.


Requirements:


Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, statistics, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.
Proven experience as a data analyst, market researcher, or similar role, with a strong track record of delivering actionable insights.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software, such as Excel, SQL, Tableau, or Power BI.
Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and draw meaningful conclusions.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy, with a commitment to producing high-quality work.
Effective communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical audiences.
Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a remote environment.


What We Offer:


Competitive salary and benefits package, including health insurance and retirement savings options.
Flexible work schedule and the opportunity to work remotely from anywhere in the United States.
Professional development opportunities, including training and certifications to support your career growth.
A supportive and collaborative team environment where your contributions are valued and recognized.

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Data Consultant: werken als Data Engineer, Data Analyst, Bi Consultant of Data Scientist?




Ben jij op zoek naar een nieuwe uitdaging met afwisseling én een goede werk-privébalans? Dan zou Datamo wel eens de plek voor jou kunnen zijn! Bij Datamo haal je het beste uit jezelf door veel kennis en ervaring op te doen bij toonaangevende organisaties. Samen met jou stellen we een persoonlijk ontwikkelplan op, zodat je specifieke expertise kunt opdoen en de gewenste opleidingen kunt volgen.




Ontvang bij Datamo een compleet pakket, zoals een salaris tot € 7.000 bruto per maand, jaarlijks 35 vrij op te nemen dagen, en bepaal zelf hoe je naar je opdrachtgevers reist met behulp van een mobiliteitsbudget, vrij te besteden voor eigen vervoer of een leaseauto (zoals een Tesla Model 3).




De functie

Als Data Consultant bij Datamo krijg je de kans om jouw talenten te benutten en waardevolle ervaring op te doen bij diverse spraakmakende opdrachtgevers als financiële instellingen zoals de ING of overheidsorganisaties zoals ministeries of overige organisaties zoals KLM, NS en nog veel meer. Bij Datamo werk je op projectbasis, van 3 maanden tot 1 jaar, of indien gewenst zelfs langer. Je werkt in diverse rollen, zoals Data Engineer, Data Analyst of Data Scientist, afhankelijk van jouw voorkeur, ervaring en expertise. Voor wat jouw specifieke opdracht betreft zullen wij verschillende keuzes aan je voorleggen. Jij bepaalt uiteindelijk helemaal zelf welke opdracht je gaat uitvoeren, want wij willen niets liever dan dat jij op een plek zit die helemaal bij je past




Jouw taken

Het exacte takenpakket hangt volledig af van de opdracht die je gaat vervullen en natuurlijk ook van de organisatie waarvoor je aan de slag gaat.




Onderstaande taken kun je onder andere verwachten bij verschillende rollen als Data Consultant:

• Data analyseren om belangrijke patronen en trends te ontdekken

• Data Clustering, Data Mining en Data Visualisatie.

• Gesprekspartner zijn voor eindgebruikers om visualisaties optimaal te maken

• Data integreren voor het optimaliseren van analyses.

• Advies verstrekken over het effectief gebruiken van data voor besluitvorming.

• Rapporten opstellen om complexe data inzichtelijk te maken voor collega’s.

• Het ontwikkelen van producten en innovatieve modellen goed laten samengaan met software-oplossingen.




Wie zoeken wij?

Wij zoeken een enthousiaste en leergierige collega die het leuk vindt projectmatig ervaring op te doen in diverse branches, organisaties en functies. Daarnaast:

Heb je minimaal 2 jaar relevante werkervaring.
Ben je in het bezit van een hbo-/wo-diploma.
Ben je in staat goede relaties op te bouwen en te onderhouden met onze opdrachtgevers.
Weet jij wel raad met Python, R, VBA, JavaScript, Power BI (Tableau, Qlik), SQL, Excel en Azure/AWS.
Beschik je over sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.
Heb je een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal (schrijven en spreken).




Wat kun je verwachten van Datamo?

Datamo is onderdeel van de grotere ‘Thuis van’-formule, wat betekent dat je onderdeel bent van een grotere organisatie bestaande uit 75 collega’s, die werkzaam zijn bij Datamo (Data Specialisten), Entrador (Business Analisten), Specktor (Product Owners) en Strates (Roostersoftware Specialisten). Onderling delen we kennis en netwerk met elkaar. Allen met dezelfde normen en waarden: het creëren van een thuisgevoel, het beste uit iedereen halen door jou zo goed mogelijk te faciliteren.




Datamo is een platte organisatie, je vindt bij ons geen onnodige directie of managementlagen, maar wel korte communicatielijnen. Jouw potentieel en geluk staan centraal, en wij willen jou daar graag in ondersteunen. Je bent bij ons zeker geen nummer, maar wel een hele belangrijke collega!

En laten we eerlijk zijn, bij Datamo wordt “data crunchen” ineens een stuk gezelliger. We combineren vakinhoudelijke ontwikkeling met sociale activiteiten, zodat je niet alleen groeit in je vakgebied, maar ook in je connecties binnen het team. We organiseren regelmatig groepsactiviteiten waarbij geldt dat je niet moet, maar mag deelnemen!

Last but not least… Bij Datamo is de balans tussen werk en privé erg belangrijk. Niet voor niets geven we je 35 vrij op te nemen dagen per jaar en overwerken staat niet in ons vocabulaire.




Wat bieden wij jou?

Een uitstekend salaris tussen de € 4.500 en € 7.000 bruto per maand, bestaande uit een vast en een variabel component.
35 vrij op te nemen dagen per jaar.
Een meer dan goede pensioenregeling.
Mobiliteitsbudget, vrij te besteden voor flexibel zakelijk vervoer: NS, fiets, taxi, Uber, deelauto, je eigen auto etc. en/of te besteden voor een eigen leaseauto.
Een MacBook Air.
Een maandelijkse telefoonvergoeding.
Gezellige uitjes, georganiseerd door en voor Datamo collega’s!
Waardevolle (in-house) trainings- en kennissessies.
Goede opleidingsmogelijkheden, ‘’the sky is the limit’’.
Meerdere interessante bonusregelingen voor bijvoorbeeld het aandragen van nieuwe collega’s.
Een fijne werkplek in ons monumentale pand in het centrum van het mooie Amersfoort.




Enthousiast geworden?

Klaar voor een nieuwe uitdaging? Solliciteer nu en haal alles uit jouw carrière met interessante projecten en kansen om je vaardigheden te ontwikkelen!

Wil je eerst vrijblijvend met een van je toekomstige collega’s praten over waarom je bij Datamo zou willen werken en wat zij doen qua opdrachten? Dat kan natuurlijk ook! We brengen je graag in contact!.

Show more
