Title: Business Intelligence Analyst, Jigsaw (Remote) - $100,000/year USD
Description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Jigsaw. Have you got what it takes?

The software industry is rapidly evolving, driven by the demand for more immediate, actionable insights. Traditional business intelligence tools often fall short in delivering the speed and depth of analysis that clients require in a fast-paced, data-driven environment. Businesses that can’t keep up with this demand risk losing out to competitors who are more agile and technologically advanced. Our approach to this challenge is to merge cutting-edge AI with proven BI tools to create a new breed of business intelligence solutions. By integrating generative AI into platforms like Tableau and Alteryx, we’re transforming them into powerful, predictive tools that can significantly enhance client satisfaction and drive business success.

This role is not for someone looking to simply run complex data models or stay behind the scenes. It’s about practical application—using AI and BI to build data visualizations and pipelines that are as reliable as they are innovative. Unlike a data scientist role, which might focus more on theoretical models, this position demands a deep understanding of client needs and a commitment to turning those needs into tangible, high-quality solutions. This is a client-centric role where your ability to consult, advise, and deliver will set you apart.

At Jigsaw you will be joining a team at the forefront of AI-enhanced business intelligence, where your contributions will directly influence the direction of the industry. If you’re passionate about pushing the boundaries of what’s possible with AI and BI, and you thrive in a dynamic, client-focused environment, this is the opportunity to make a real impact.

What You Will Be Doing


Data Visualization Creation: Producing Tableau dashboards and other data visualization outputs for clients
Data Pipeline Development: Building and enhancing data workflows using Alteryx
Client Consultation: Engaging with clients to define requirements, provide recommendations, and ensure that our solutions meet their business needs


Business Intelligence Analyst Key Responsibilities


Use AI to accelerate the delivery of business intelligence solutions and significantly improve client satisfaction


Basic Requirements


Must be based in the European Union, United Kingdom, or EEA
At least 5 years of professional experience delivering complex BI projects
Expertise in Tableau and Alteryx
Professional experience using generative AI tools to speed up BI processes
Professional experience translating technical information into non-technical business language that customers can easily understand


About Jigsaw

Delivered on a software-as-a-service (SaaS) platform, Jigsaw’s virtual learning and collaboration technology enables our customers to revolutionize how they train, educate, collaborate and work through a virtual environment – helping them embrace digital transformation and enhance their organizations’ success.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

Working with Crossover

This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.

What to expect next:


You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


Important! If you do not receive an email from us:


First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.


Crossover Job Code: LJ-5409-SE-Stockhol-BusinessIntell1.001

Title: Data and GIS Analyst
Description:
We are hiring a GIS Analyst

Nordregio is expanding its GIS team by adding a new Nordic-speaking GIS analyst/Cartographer member. We are looking for candidates with an inter-discipline interest, analytical and technical skills.

The candidate shall have a strong cartographic and GIS capability and educational background and with interest and experience in regional development, human geography, or social studies.

About The GIS Team

The GIS team stands for some of the key outputs of Nordregio. Key team’s tasks include data collection, harmonization and analysis on a fine geographical scale; visualization of the information on the maps and infographics; reporting on the analysis and dissemination of the results verbally and in the written form. Occasional domestic and international work trips are included in the job obligations.

All the requirements in the list below are relevant for the position. The candidate shall indicate the current skills and experience together with the work-related and development interests.

Requirements


For this position, you must have a degree in geoscience, urban and regional planning, human geography, social sciences, or other relevant disciplines.
Experience in statistical and spatial data collection, analysis and visualization with GIS software, such as ArcGIS Pro, QGIS or other tools. Experience working with micro data would be a plus.
Experience with web-mapping solutions, such as ArcGIS Online and other tools.
Knowledge of programming languages (e.g., Python, R or other) is desirable.
Highly motivated and capable of working independently, while also thriving in a collaborative research setting.
Strong communication skills with the ability to network and work effectively with various stakeholders and partner organizations.
Professional fluency in English and a Nordic language is essential.
You need to be a citizen in a Nordic or EU/ESS country.


Main Work Tasks


Participate alongside the team of researchers in diverse projects within the Nordic Region, the Baltic Sea Region, the European Union, and beyond.
Collect and harmonize statistical and spatial data on different geographical scales from diverse sources.
Perform statistical data analysis, including exploratory analysis and statistical modelling.
Perform GIS analysis, including spatial and network analysis.
Develop clear and informative maps, graphs, and other visualizations using ArcGIS Pro and other tools.
Document the data collection, harmonization and analysis processes.
Prepare written reports and verbal presentations to share conclusions and insights.
Contribute to tendering and dissemination of Nordregio research.
Being part of the team, you will create an individual development plan and be assigned a mentor to assist with your professional growth.


Why Nordregio?

Nordregio is an international research centre for regional development and planning. We conduct solution-oriented and applied research, addressing current issues from both an academic perspective and from the viewpoint of policymakers and practitioners. Nordregio participates in European, Nordic, and national research programs and carries out commissioned projects for different levels of government. We conduct case studies in different regions, perform territorial analyses on a transnational and pan-European level, and undertake evaluations of various European and national programs.

We are a multidisciplinary, international team. The office is situated in the center of Stockholm on Skeppsholmen, Sweden. The institute was established in 1997 by the Nordic Council of Ministers and is built on 50 years of Nordic collaboration.

Working at Nordregio provides you with the opportunity to become part of an international research environment. We offer career development potential in terms of enhancing your international network of contacts in both policy and academic fields, as well as extensive experience with project management. You will also collaborate with regional and municipal stakeholders in the Nordic countries.

Application and contact

Upload your cv, letter of motivation and references no later than 20.09.2024.

The interviews are scheduled to start the second week of October 2024 via Teams.

The candidate evaluation process will be conducted based on a motivation letter and combination of your skills and interests. Be clear in describing your skills, interests, and motivation behind why you are interested in the position.

We intend the position to be full-time and start as soon as possible. We offer competitive salaries and a fixed-term contract with a maximum length of four years. Subject to further agreement the contract can be renewed for up to another four years.

Note that you are entitled to leave of absence from your current position for the duration of your employment at Nordregio if you are employed by the State in a Nordic country. More information can be found in the agreement “Avtale om rettstilling for samnordiske institusjoner og deres ansate”.

For our employees to perform at a high level, we support, in various ways, the employee’s own responsibility and initiative to find a balance between work and private life. Generous health benefits, encouraging social gatherings, and peer-to-peer learning are some examples of support.

For further information, please contact:


Senior Cartographer / GIS Analyst: Maria Bobrinskaya (maria.bobrinskaya@nordregio.org or +46 76 6166861)
Cartographer/ GIS Analyst: Anna Vasilevskaya (anna.vasilevskaya@nordregio.org +46 70 8118016)
Local union representative: Hilma Salonen (hilma.salonen@nordregio.org or phone + 46 76 1695055)


For further information about Nordregio, see www.nordregio.org

Title: GIS Analyst

Organization: Nordregio

City: Stockholm

Application Deadline: 20.09.2024

Employment conditions: Nordic conditions

Job Category: Employment with a Nordic institution or partner
Show more
HTML:
We are hiring a GIS Analyst

Nordregio is expanding its GIS team by adding a new Nordic-speaking GIS analyst/Cartographer member. We are looking for candidates with an inter-discipline interest, analytical and technical skills.

The candidate shall have a strong cartographic and GIS capability and educational background and with interest and experience in regional development, human geography, or social studies.

About The GIS Team

The GIS team stands for some of the key outputs of Nordregio. Key team’s tasks include data collection, harmonization and analysis on a fine geographical scale; visualization of the information on the maps and infographics; reporting on the analysis and dissemination of the results verbally and in the written form. Occasional domestic and international work trips are included in the job obligations.

All the requirements in the list below are relevant for the position. The candidate shall indicate the current skills and experience together with the work-related and development interests.

Requirements

  • For this position, you must have a degree in geoscience, urban and regional planning, human geography, social sciences, or other relevant disciplines.
  • Experience in statistical and spatial data collection, analysis and visualization with GIS software, such as ArcGIS Pro, QGIS or other tools. Experience working with micro data would be a plus.
  • Experience with web-mapping solutions, such as ArcGIS Online and other tools.
  • Knowledge of programming languages (e.g., Python, R or other) is desirable.
  • Highly motivated and capable of working independently, while also thriving in a collaborative research setting.
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to network and work effectively with various stakeholders and partner organizations.
  • Professional fluency in English and a Nordic language is essential.
  • You need to be a citizen in a Nordic or EU/ESS country.

Main Work Tasks

  • Participate alongside the team of researchers in diverse projects within the Nordic Region, the Baltic Sea Region, the European Union, and beyond.
  • Collect and harmonize statistical and spatial data on different geographical scales from diverse sources.
  • Perform statistical data analysis, including exploratory analysis and statistical modelling.
  • Perform GIS analysis, including spatial and network analysis.
  • Develop clear and informative maps, graphs, and other visualizations using ArcGIS Pro and other tools.
  • Document the data collection, harmonization and analysis processes.
  • Prepare written reports and verbal presentations to share conclusions and insights.
  • Contribute to tendering and dissemination of Nordregio research.
  • Being part of the team, you will create an individual development plan and be assigned a mentor to assist with your professional growth.

Why Nordregio?

Nordregio is an international research centre for regional development and planning. We conduct solution-oriented and applied research, addressing current issues from both an academic perspective and from the viewpoint of policymakers and practitioners. Nordregio participates in European, Nordic, and national research programs and carries out commissioned projects for different levels of government. We conduct case studies in different regions, perform territorial analyses on a transnational and pan-European level, and undertake evaluations of various European and national programs.

We are a multidisciplinary, international team. The office is situated in the center of Stockholm on Skeppsholmen, Sweden. The institute was established in 1997 by the Nordic Council of Ministers and is built on 50 years of Nordic collaboration.

Working at Nordregio provides you with the opportunity to become part of an international research environment. We offer career development potential in terms of enhancing your international network of contacts in both policy and academic fields, as well as extensive experience with project management. You will also collaborate with regional and municipal stakeholders in the Nordic countries.

Application and contact

Upload your cv, letter of motivation and references no later than 20.09.2024.

The interviews are scheduled to start the second week of October 2024 via Teams.

The candidate evaluation process will be conducted based on a motivation letter and combination of your skills and interests. Be clear in describing your skills, interests, and motivation behind why you are interested in the position.

We intend the position to be full-time and start as soon as possible. We offer competitive salaries and a fixed-term contract with a maximum length of four years. Subject to further agreement the contract can be renewed for up to another four years.

Note that you are entitled to leave of absence from your current position for the duration of your employment at Nordregio if you are employed by the State in a Nordic country. More information can be found in the agreement “Avtale om rettstilling for samnordiske institusjoner og deres ansate”.

For our employees to perform at a high level, we support, in various ways, the employee’s own responsibility and initiative to find a balance between work and private life. Generous health benefits, encouraging social gatherings, and peer-to-peer learning are some examples of support.

For further information, please contact:

  • Senior Cartographer / GIS Analyst: Maria Bobrinskaya (maria.bobrinskaya@nordregio.org or +46 76 6166861)
  • Cartographer/ GIS Analyst: Anna Vasilevskaya (anna.vasilevskaya@nordregio.org +46 70 8118016)
  • Local union representative: Hilma Salonen (hilma.salonen@nordregio.org or phone + 46 76 1695055)

For further information about Nordregio, see www.nordregio.org

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
På B3 Business Transformation brinner vi för att hjälpa företag och organisationer att använda sin information i sina datakällor för att göra smartare beslut. Vi har idag ett gäng grymma business intelligence-stjärnor med stor passion och intresse för utveckling och arkitektur inom Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence,- front och back end. Vi har bland annat ett nära samarbete med Microsoft och är Managed Partner och Gold Partner inom områden såsom till exempel Data Platform och Application Development. Vi samarbetar även med andra partners såklart som SAS, Qlik, Oracle, Informatica med flera.

Vi erbjuder dig...


Ett utvecklande arbete i nära samarbete med Microsoft eller någon av våra andra partners
Från den första dagen har du möjligheter att påverka både uppdragsinriktning och din egen kompetensutveckling tillsammans med oss
Goda möjligheter att påverka din egen arbetssituation och inriktning genom en flexibel lönemodell som andas frihet under ansvar
En arbetsplats där vi tycker att balans i livet är viktigt och där vi satsar på gemenskap och Wellness


Vi tror att du idag…


Är en fullfjädrad BI-utvecklare troligtvis inom någon av följande tekniker - Microsoft (SQL, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Power BI), Qlik View och Qlik Sense, SAS, Tableau. Även andra tekniker kan var av intresse
Har genomfört ett antal kundnära systemutvecklingsprojekt
Är social, kreativ och gillar att jobba i team och hantera kundrelationer
Vill utvecklas och känner ödmjukhet inför kundernas utmaningar
Har relevant universitets-/högskoleexamen eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
Ser möjligheterna / har erfarenhet av Azure i någon mån


Vem söker vi?

Vi värdesätter personlighet och driv hos individen. Du ska helst vara lagspelare och en nyfiken person som har arbetat inom BI-området tidigare. Det är av betydelse för våra kunder att du behärskar det svenska språket i tal och skrift (it is important for our customers that you master the Swedish language in speech and writing).

Känns detta spännande och du vill veta mer? - Tveka i så fall inte att ansöka! Eller kontakta Mats Erkers på mats.erkers@b3.se eller 0705394705

HYBRID WORK MODEL

If you would like immediate consideration, please send me an updated CV/contact details to jcaria@redglobal.com so we can discuss further or reach out to me through LinkedIn

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description:

Merkle Sweden - a Dentsu company is a consultancy firm with expertise in the areas of digital analytics and conversion optimization. We help large corporations and organizations collect, interpret, and act on data from their digital touchpoints, such as apps and websites, and use the data to make their communications and marketing efforts more hard-hitting.

Our extensive experience and deep proficiency in Google Analytics 360 and Google Optimize mean that our clients rely on us for their most complex, challenging assignments.

Job Description:

Merkle is looking for a driven specialist with a huge interest in data and analytics. You’ll be based in either Gothenburg or Stockholm.


Implement metrics for clients and provide regular analysis.
Give recommendations for measurement solutions for digital services based on clients’ business and activity goals.
Maintain and develop a strong know-how of Google Marketing Platform in general and Google Analytics 360 in particular. Other measurement tools may be used.
Provide insights and recommendations that improve clients’ activities and business.
Develop data-visualization solutions (in dashboards) that make it possible for clients to follow sales and other important performance indicators in real time.



Qualifications:


Minimum of 3 years’ experience in similar role
Experience working with large amounts of data and an understanding of SQL and databases.
In-depth knowledge of working with Google Analytics data, being an advanced user.
Presentation skills to both large and small groups of varying degrees of knowledge, internally within the Group and also with clients.
Ability to manage different work tasks and projects and prioritize accordingly as you will be working with several clients and projects at the same time.
Ability to work with data analysis and provide accurate recommendations based on data.
Knowledge of data-visualization tools, formal statistics training, and experience with Google Cloud (especially BigQuery) are desirable.
Good communication skills in Swedish and English, both in speaking and writing.



Some of the Perks We Offer:


We have a collective agreement and attractive benefits. Several years in a row, we have won the DI Gasell Award, won the Mästargasellen Award, and been named a “Superföretag” (Super Company) by Veckans Affärer and Bisnode.
Friendly, knowledgeable colleagues who like to share their knowledge.
Possibility to work with multinational companies in a number of different industries, meaning you get a wide range of experience and the chance to work with different data sets.
Working for a certified reseller of several Google Marketing Platform products and working closely with Google in Sweden, England, Ireland, and the United States. We are the biggest player in the Nordics when it comes to Google Analytics 360.
Continuous personal development in the form of lab days, groups exchanging experiences, and your own professional development budget.
The chance to grow both within your area of specialty and within Dentsu, the global network Merkle Northern Europe is a part of.



Inclusion and Diversity:

Our diverse and inclusive culture enables our employees to bring their whole selves to work and be proud of doing so. For us, this is the foundation for great innovation which, in turn, generates better outcomes for our people, partners and communities. This is why we encourage applications from people with disabilities, and of all ages, nationalities, backgrounds and cultures.

We are happy to discuss flexible and agile approaches to working for all our roles – we can’t promise we will be able to offer you everything you want or need but we do promise to discuss it with you openly and honestly. If you have any reasonable adjustment needs arising from a disability or medical condition to fully participate in the recruitment process, please discuss this with our recruitment teams.

About dentsu:

Dentsu Group is a global marketing communications company headquartered in Tokyo, Japan. It is one of the largest advertising and media firms in the world. The company offers a wide range of services in advertising, marketing, communication, and digital media, catering to clients across various industries.

We help clients to win, keep, and grow their best customers and achieve meaningful progress for their businesses with the best-in-class services and solutions in media, CXM, and creative. For more information please see: www.dentsu.com.

Working with us:

Joining dentsu, you’ll join a team of 72,000 people. It’s an opportunity to produce career-defining work. Along the way, you’ll team up with inspiring colleagues and encounter a richness of clients, cultures, and experiences.  We offer exciting challenges, a great working environment, memorable experiences, and opportunities to shape your future.

Contact:

We look forward to receiving your application for any questions, please contact the TA in charge of this role: Thomas Holley, Talent Acquisition Partner, EMEA, NE by email at: Thomas.holley@dentsu.com or by phone at: +45 53 84 75 82

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Det här är vi

För oss kommer människan alltid först. Och tekniken först därefter. Du ska alltid kunna vara uppkopplad med de och det som betyder mest för just dig. Vår övertygelse är att uppkopplade samhällen är starkare samhällen. Som en Telenor-medarbetare kommer du att vara en viktig pusselbit av en större internationell organisation som vill skapa samhällsnytta genom att leverera förstklassig uppkoppling i de samhällen vi verkar.




Telenor genomgår just nu en digital transformation där vi snabbt strävar efter en helt datastyrd framtid. För att stödja denna satsning investerar vi mycket i området Analytics. Vi letar nu efter en Data Engineer som vill vara en del av denna spännande resa och gå med i vårt Data & Analytics-team.




Vad du kommer att göra

Du kommer att vara en del av vårt Data & Analytics team inom Data, Analytics och Automation organisationen. Vi letar nu efter en passionerad Data Engineer som tillsammans med sitt team vill arbeta med att skapa datadrivna beslut och bidra till att driva värde genom data.




I rollen som Data Engineer kommer tillsammans med dina kollegor utveckla lösningar i vår analyticsmiljö och i en agil miljö säkerställa att vi skapar värde för organisationen på bästa möjliga sätt. Du kommer vara en del av olika projekt och samarbeta med kollegor inom såväl det tekniska som affärsnära. Vi tror på samarbete och kontinuerligt lärande. Därför kommer du att få möjlighet att lära dig av dina kollegor och dela med dig av din kunskap med andra, för att tillsammans kunna skapa de bästa möjliga resultaten.




Vem du är

För att lyckas i rollen som Data Engineer har du relevant utbildningsbakgrund och tidigare erfarenhet inom områden som Data Engineer eller liknande roll i Data Lakemiljö.




Vi tror också att du har:

Erfaren inom SQL, Python, Java, Qlik Sense/Qlik Cloud, Spark, Airflow, ETL/ELT
Erfaren inom cloud services AWS eller GCP
Erfarenhet av statistics
Bakgrund inom telekombranschen är ett stort plus
Flytande i svenska och engelska
Självgående, samarbetsvillig och lösningsorienterad




Vårt löfte

Nyckeln till vår framgång är en balanserad arbetskraft. För att säkra det arbetar vi aktivt för att främja en arbetsmiljö där våra anställda får stöd och egenmakt inom alla sina arbetsområden. Vi lovar dig ett mänskligt företag som har hög vilja till självförbättring och att snabbt anpassa sig till en digitaliserad värld.




Du välkomnas varmt in till ett skickligt team av professionella kolleger och utöver detta erbjuder vi även:

Ett flexibelt arbetssätt. Vi tror på att flexibiliteten och friheten att välja var och när du levererar i ditt arbete bidrar till ökad prestation, engagemang och balans i livet. Vi tror också på styrkan i att vi är bättre tillsammans och att teamandan utvecklas när vi möts och interagerar med varandra, därför ser vi att våra kontor ska agera som magneter för samarbete, kreativitet och företagsanda.
Utbildningsprogram så att du som medarbetare kan fördjupa din kunskap och bredda kompetensen.
Ett generöst hälsovårdspaket innehållandes exempelvis ”give me a break-days”, friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension och mycket mer.




Sök till oss idag

Om du tycker att det här låter intressant och vill höra mer, vänligen kontakta Marta Jagebro, marta.jagebro@telenor.se. Skicka inte din cv via mail, dessa kommer inte att utvärderas.

Sista ansökningsdagen: vi arbetar löpande så sök idag!

Placeringsort: Stockholm




Bra att känna till

Enligt Telenors policy genomför vi bakgrundskontroll på slutkandidat för samtliga rekryteringar.

Show more

  • Ett flexibelt arbetssätt. Vi tror på att flexibiliteten och friheten att välja var och när du levererar i ditt arbete bidrar till ökad prestation, engagemang och balans i livet. Vi tror också på styrkan i att vi är bättre tillsammans och att teamandan utvecklas när vi möts och interagerar med varandra, därför ser vi att våra kontor ska agera som magneter för samarbete, kreativitet och företagsanda.
  • Utbildningsprogram så att du som medarbetare kan fördjupa din kunskap och bredda kompetensen.
  • Ett generöst hälsovårdspaket innehållandes exempelvis ”give me a break-days”, friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension och mycket mer.


Sök till oss idag

Om du tycker att det här låter intressant och vill höra mer, vänligen kontakta Marta Jagebro, marta.jagebro@telenor.se. Skicka inte din cv via mail, dessa kommer inte att utvärderas.

Sista ansökningsdagen: vi arbetar löpande så sök idag!

Placeringsort: Stockholm


Bra att känna till

Enligt Telenors policy genomför vi bakgrundskontroll på slutkandidat för samtliga rekryteringar.

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Description:
Company Description

We're an award-winning Google Cloud partner. We're the experts in transforming businesses and shaping the future of cloud technology. Join us and collaborate with top minds, build groundbreaking solutions, and make a real difference for our clients. Enjoy extensive professional development, global reach, and a supportive, Google-inspired culture. If you're passionate about the cloud, this is where you want to be.

With over 13 years of experience in Google Cloud under our belt, offices in 18 countries and more than 600 experts, we have deployed practical innovation alongside Google. We focus on infrastructure modernisation, data management, smart analytics, application modernisation, and AI & machine learning.

Curious about our projects? We got you: Check out our success stories


Job Description

Day-to-day life 

Design, develop, and deploy data solutions (think databases, pipelines, and warehouses) – tailor-made for clients
Work with team members and Google experts to guide customers to new solutions and through complex data challenges
help junior colleagues become data masters and foster a culture of continuous learning
Work with the latest developments in Google Cloud Platform and continue to develop your expertise
Manage presentations and direct communication with clients, bridging the gap between customers and technical solutions



Want to know more? Check out our people stories on Youtube


Qualifications

We're looking for a data virtuoso with five years of proven experience in designing, developing, and deploying databases, data pipelines, and data warehouses. You'll be a cloud champion who understands data warehousing concepts, setups, and design patterns within the Google Cloud Platform. As a coding mastermind, you'll possess strong SQL and Python or Java skills and a passion for exploring new technologies. 



Excellent communication is key – you'll build relationships with clients, translate their needs into actionable solutions, and present complex topics with clarity and confidence. Finally, you're a team player at heart, thriving in collaborative environments where you can share knowledge, mentor others, and foster a culture of open communication and support.


Additional Information

Why Choose Devoteam G Cloud?

Own the AI revolution: Dive into the exciting world of Generative AI and ML, playing a pivotal role in shaping projects around Google's groundbreaking Gemini foundation model.
Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.
End-to-End Impact: Drive complete business transformations, from strategy to implementation and beyond.
Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.



"Partnering with Devoteam has been a highlight of our efforts at Google Cloud. Their dedication and expertise elevate every project we undertake together. It's truly a collaboration that delivers exceptional results." — Alexander Percivall, Senior Partner Engineer, Google Cloud Nordics, Stockholm, Sweden.

We do plenty of activities, like meet-ups, hackathons, and partnerships. Don’t lose any of them: follow us on LinkedIn



Benefits

Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.
Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.
A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.
An international, diverse, and inclusive team.
A human-centric and value-based company culture.
Wellness grants for sports activities (5,000 SEK/year).
A modern office in central Stockholm.
Full provision of work tools.
A variety of social events.



Our culture is based on continuous learning and career development, supported by a genuine, inclusive, and expert team that really loves pizza.

 

Want to know more about life at Devoteam? Check our Instagram page



Ready to join an elite team? Apply for our Lead Data Engineer position and become part of something exceptional!



Is this not the right position for you? Don’t worry, we have plenty of opportunities! Check out our Career page

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About Kambi

Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.

Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.

About Tzeract:

Tzeract is a pioneering sports betting AI pricing company, operating as an agile startup within the larger ecosystem of Kambi Group ( https://kambi.com/ ). Our mission is to revolutionize the sports betting industry by leveraging cutting-edge technology and advanced analytics to enable the next generation of sports betting experiences. With a focus on both historical and real-time sports data, we're building systems that outperform the market and deliver value to our users.

To know more about us - https://tzeract.com/

Role Overview:

We're seeking a skilled Data Engineer with a passion for sports and a keen eye for statistics to join our dynamic team. This role is pivotal in designing, building, and maintaining our data infrastructure, ensuring the seamless flow and integrity of large-scale sports data sets. You will work closely with our data scientists and developers, turning complex data into actionable insights that drive our AI algorithms.

Responsibilities:



Develop and maintain scalable and robust data pipelines for real-time and historical sports data ingestion, processing, and analysis using Python and AWS services.
Implement and manage AWS cloud-based solutions to ensure high availability, performance, and security of our data infrastructure.
Collaborate with data scientists to understand data requirements for AI model development and provide the necessary data engineering support.
Apply your expertise in statistics and data analysis to enhance data quality and the effectiveness of our AI algorithms.
Monitor data pipelines and systems performance, troubleshoot data issues, and implement optimizations.
Stay updated with the latest technologies and methodologies in data engineering and sports analytics to continuously improve our data systems.



Qualifications:



Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data engineering, with a strong proficiency in Python.
Extensive experience with AWS services (e.g., S3, EC2, RDS, Lambda, Redshift) and managing cloud-based data infrastructure.
Solid understanding of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing principles.
Experience with real-time data processing and streaming technologies is highly desirable.
A good eye for statistics and experience in statistical modeling or analysis.
Passion for sports and sports data analysis is a big plus.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced startup environment.



Why Join Us:



Be part of a cutting-edge project that's shaping the future of sports betting.
Work in an environment that values innovation, collaboration, and a data-driven approach.
Enjoy a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and flexible working arrangements.
Engage in continuous learning and growth opportunities within an ambitious tech startup.



How to Apply:

Send your resume, a brief cover letter explaining why you're a good fit for this role, and any relevant portfolio links or GitHub repository to us. Please include "Data Engineer Application" in the subject line.

We're excited to hear from you and explore how you can contribute to our team!

#wearekambi

Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace

If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.

Creating an inclusive environment

We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.

#wearekambi

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Palm is a company that welcomes applicants from all backgrounds!

Join us at Palm, a well-funded, early-stage fintech startup, on a mission to guide the world’s money flows. As part of our founding team of treasurers, finance specialists, and engineers, you'll help build a world-class treasury management system for enterprises.

Are you ready to build and own the data intra function from the ground up? Based in Amsterdam or Stockholm and open to mostly remote work? We want to hear from you!

About Palm Engineering

Engineering at Palm today consists of a team of five engineers with diverse engineering and cultural backgrounds. We are located in Amsterdam and Stockholm, mostly working remotely with frequent gatherings in one of our locations or at off-sites where it is warmer and sunnier 🏖️

The engineering team has been working together since November 2023 so there is still a lot of opportunities for high impact work as well as playing an important role in further shaping the engineering organisation and culture.

Palm Engineering is defined by our principles:


Bias to Action: In the face of uncertainty, we prototype fast and often.
Open Communication: We courageously voice concerns to realign our direction as needed.
Passion for Challenges: We love the problem and embrace challenges.


In order to achieve this we lean on a culture of collaboration and knowledge sharing, where curiosity, respect and openness are some of our guiding principles. We truly value diversity and are happy to have our perspectives challenged. And of course, let’s have fun together!

Our tech stack


Data Pipelines: Python, BigQuery
Database: PostgreSQL
Cloud: GCP
Version Control: Git
We are continuously iterating and exploring technologies as we go - so there’s more to come!


How will you make an impact?

After receiving a strong customer response of our data-intensive features, we now want to elevate them to the next level. In this role, you will be responsible for setting up the foundation for Palm's data infrastructure, collaborating with our ML engineer to deploy ML models and data pipelines to production, developing internal tools for various stakeholders to interact with data, and building infrastructure to monitor and improve performance. You’ll likely bring in new technologies to accomplish this.

Your role will involve close collaboration with engineers, designers, and founders (who bring expertise from Fintech & Treasury) to determine how Data can best serve Palm’s customers.

Our wish list

We are looking for a proactive and eternally curious person with a love for learning new things. The successful candidate will have experience maintaining production-level ML solutions and possess solid software engineering and ML principles. Strong Python and SQL skills are essential. You will likely have 5+ years of experience in software engineering, data science, or machine learning, including at least 2 years in data engineering or MLOps. We highly value the ability to collaborate effectively, a clear sense of ownership and clear communication. Experience with GCP would be a nice bonus, but it's not required.

Benefits Of Working At Palm


Travel: Meet all your new colleagues at quarterly offsites - the last 3 were in Lisbon, Stockholm & Amsterdam.
WeWork Membership: Work from home is our go-to - we love spending time with friends and family instead of commuting. We have WeWork memberships for when you want to escape into the city.
Stock Options: Own a large chunk of Palm and reap the rewards as you help us grow the company to a global player.
Pension & Health Insurance: Best-in-class local insurances and pension schemes so you don't have to worry.
Wellness Stipend: 500 EUR in annual wellness benefits - gyms, massages, you name it.

Title: Data Steward
Description:
Job ID: 24725 

Are you a graduate with an IT background or an IT/Data analyst looking to build competence in data management? 

We are now looking for a motivated Data Steward to support implementation of data governance initiatives, maintain business critical data with a view to improve data quality and reduce risk, and build strong stakeholder relationships.  

At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast – and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That’s why we’re deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers.

 

We’re creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together – and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger. 



About this opportunity 

Welcome to AWM COO in the Application Portfolio and Data Management team. You’ll join AWM COO, a professional, fun and collaborative unit striving to “make it happen” – delivering excellence through tangible results. This will be a unique opportunity for you to grow your career not only in Nordea but also in data governance.  

What you’ll be doing: 

You will be responsible for metadata maintenance and documentation, implementing data quality controls and supporting risk mitigation activities
You will be responsible for performing BAU activities such as extracting data sets, configuring rules in relevant systems, and supporting with data classification and naming
You will implement and be responsible for deliveries in various projects and initiatives in the bank
You will work cross-functionally with stakeholders and contribute to developing communication materials, training, instructions on data usage

The role is based in Stockholm or Helsinki.



Who you are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  We are looking for a pro-active, energetic and results-driven individual to take this role to the next level and who sees this as an opportunity to grow in the data governance field!

To succeed in this role, we believe that: 

You have a strong drive and the strategic ability to see what needs to be done, both in the short and long term, with a solution-oriented mindset
You enjoy investigating and gathering information about data, and have attention to detail
You have strong collaboration skills and work well in a team environment
You have excellent stakeholder management skills, can navigate and collaborate across the value chain in AWM and Nordea
You have good English skills, both written and orally.



 Your experience and background: 

You have a minimum of 1 year relevant experience working with data in business, project or data management related role (or equivalent coursework experience)
Experience working with data quality, standards or controls
Work experience using SQL (or equivalent coursework experience)
Knowledge of savings products and business model is an advantage 

 

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

 

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 30/09/2024. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Clara San Inocencio on tel: +46737471848 or e-mail: clara.san.inocencio@nordea.com.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

 

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered. 

 

If you are an external consultant interested in this role and wish to apply please contact the hiring people leader for separate instruction on how to apply.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Company Description

We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people! We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.

With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level. We are looking for you who want to grow with us!

With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.

Job Description

In this exciting and critical role, you will be involved in one of the biggest data transformation journey. As a data engineer, you will be working with building of data products in the context of Data Mesh concept based on defined target vision and requirements.

We appreciate a multitude of technical backgrounds, and we believe you will enjoy working here if you are passionate about data. In this role, you will be required to implement data-intensive solutions for a data-driven organization.

You will join the Data Engineering Competence area within AI (Artificial Intelligence), Analytics & Data Domain and be an individual contributor in one of the data product-teams. The area supports all our brands globally to create, structure, guard and ensure data is available, understandable and of high quality.

Responsibilities:


Take end-to-end responsibility to build, optimize and support of existing and new data products towards the defined target vision
Be a champion of DevOps mindset and principles and able to manage CI/CD pipelines and terraform as well as Cloud infrastructure, in our context, it is GCP (Google Cloud Platform).
Ensure that our built data products work as independent units of deployment and non-functional aspects of the data products follow the defined standards for security, scalability, observability, and performance.
Work close to the Product Owner and other stakeholders around vision for existing data products and identifying new data products to support our customer needs
Work with product teams within and outside our domain around topics that relate to the data mesh concept.
Evaluate and drive continuous improvement and reducing technical debt in the teams
Maintain expertise in latest data/analytics and cloud technologies



Qualifications


Passion for Data, people, and technology
At least 4+ years work experience including hands-on as either:
Data engineer on GCP/modern cloud data platforms /or advanced analytics environments.
Software Engineer with cloud technologies and infrastructure
Experience in GCP tools Dataflow, Dataproc and Bigquery
Experience in different data formats (Parquet, Avro)
Experience in data query languages (SQL or similar)
Experience in data centric programming using one of more programming languages Python, Java /or Scala.
Good understanding of different data modelling techniques and trade-off
Knowledge of NoSQL and RDBMS databases
Have a collaborative and co-creative mindset with excellent communication skills
Motivated to work in an environment that allows you to work and take decisions independently
Experience in working with data visualization tools
Fluent in English both written and verbal



Advantage if you also have:


Experience in data processing framework Beam, Spark, Hive, Flink
Business understanding of retail industry



We are looking for you who:

Start: Immediately

Location: Stockholm

Form of employment: Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment

We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people! We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.

With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level. We are looking for you who want to grow with us!

With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.

Job Description

In this exciting and critical role, you will be involved in one of the biggest data transformation journey. As a data engineer, you will be working with building of data products in the context of Data Mesh concept based on defined target vision and requirements.

We appreciate a multitude of technical backgrounds, and we believe you will enjoy working here if you are passionate about data. In this role, you will be required to implement data-intensive solutions for a data-driven organization.

You will join the Data Engineering Competence area within AI (Artificial Intelligence), Analytics & Data Domain and be an individual contributor in one of the data product-teams. The area supports all our brands globally to create, structure, guard and ensure data is available, understandable and of high quality.

Responsibilities:

  • Take end-to-end responsibility to build, optimize and support of existing and new data products towards the defined target vision
  • Be a champion of DevOps mindset and principles and able to manage CI/CD pipelines and terraform as well as Cloud infrastructure, in our context, it is GCP (Google Cloud Platform).
  • Ensure that our built data products work as independent units of deployment and non-functional aspects of the data products follow the defined standards for security, scalability, observability, and performance.
  • Work close to the Product Owner and other stakeholders around vision for existing data products and identifying new data products to support our customer needs
  • Work with product teams within and outside our domain around topics that relate to the data mesh concept.
  • Evaluate and drive continuous improvement and reducing technical debt in the teams
  • Maintain expertise in latest data/analytics and cloud technologies


Qualifications

  • Passion for Data, people, and technology
  • At least 4+ years work experience including hands-on as either:
    • Data engineer on GCP/modern cloud data platforms /or advanced analytics environments.
    • Software Engineer with cloud technologies and infrastructure
    • Experience in GCP tools Dataflow, Dataproc and Bigquery
    • Experience in different data formats (Parquet, Avro)
    • Experience in data query languages (SQL or similar)
    • Experience in data centric programming using one of more programming languages Python, Java /or Scala.
    • Good understanding of different data modelling techniques and trade-off
    • Knowledge of NoSQL and RDBMS databases
    • Have a collaborative and co-creative mindset with excellent communication skills
    • Motivated to work in an environment that allows you to work and take decisions independently
    • Experience in working with data visualization tools
    • Fluent in English both written and verbal


    Advantage if you also have:

    • Experience in data processing framework Beam, Spark, Hive, Flink
    • Business understanding of retail industry


    We are looking for you who:

    Start: Immediately

    Location: Stockholm

    Form of employment: Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment

    We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.

Title: Områdesarkitekt, Data & Analys
Description:
Varje dag reser närmare 900 000 personer med den allmänna kollektivtrafiken i Stockholm. Höga krav på en väl utbyggd, lättillgänglig och pålitlig kollektivtrafik innebär höga krav på IT.

Vi söker nu en erfaren Områdesarkitekt inom Data & Analys. Här får du en unik möjlighet att inte bara påverka och driva utvecklingen av våra datatillgångar och analyslösningar, utan också leda oss genom en spännande förändringsresa där vi bygger nytt och tar stora steg framåt.

Trafikförvaltningen genomgår en digital transformation, pådriven av samhällsutvecklingen och branschens digitalisering. En viktig del i detta är att stärka vår datadrivna förmåga, vilket gör Data & Analys till ett av våra främsta fokusområden och rollen som områdesarkitekt avgörande för vår framgång.

Gruppen Data & Analys är en del av sektionen Interna Tjänster. Vårt uppdrag är att ansvara för att läsa in, lagra och tillgängliggöra datatillgångar och geografisk information, samt modellera och kvalitetssäkra data för analyser.

Bli en viktig del av vårt engagerade team på Trafikförvaltningen!

Om rollen

Som Områdesarkitekt inom Data & Analys kommer du att spela en central roll i att stödja Trafikförvaltningens IT-utveckling och säkerställa att våra tekniska lösningar möter verksamhetens strategiska behov. Du kommer att arbeta nära verksamheten, med fokus på att bidra redan i de tidiga faserna av nya initiativ och se till att arbetet följer vår målarkitektur, våra principer, riktlinjer och standarder.

I rollen som Områdesarkitekt ingår bland annat att:


Sätta strategiska inriktningar tillsammans med portföljledare, gruppchef och Enterprise arkitekt
Ansvara för områdets arkitekturstyrning och att de artefakter som krävs i IT-arkitekturprocessen inom domänen tas fram
Driva arkitektrådet inom Data & Analys
Delta i portföljarbete kring nya initiativ och budgetplanering
Stötta i upphandlingar och avtalsskrivningar
Etablera och förändra verksamhetsförmågor samt dokumentera dessa
Stödja produktägare för att definiera produkter och tjänster
Vara en ambassadör för området Data & Analys
Delta i Trafikförvaltningens övergripande arkitektråd och samverka med Regionen och sjukhus.



Viktiga kontaktytor är Produktägare, Enterprise arkitekt, Lösningsarkitekter, Tech Leads och verksamheten. Du ingår även i ledningsgruppen för Data & Analys.

Vad vi söker efter

Vi söker dig med både bred och djup kompetens inom Data & Analys och dess olika arkitekturer inklusive AI och GIS. Du har dokumenterad erfarenhet av att utveckla och konkretisera målarkitektur samt att implementera lösningar som både är tekniskt avancerade och affärsmässigt relevanta.

Du har en stark kommunikativ förmåga, både i tal och skrift, och är skicklig på att visualisera komplexa idéer. Du samarbetar effektivt med både verksamhets- och tekniska roller och har en naturlig förmåga att skapa tillit och förtroende.

För att trivas och lyckas i rollen behöver du:


Relevant högskoleutbildning på minst tre år eller motsvarande kunskap genom arbetslivserfarenhet
Minst två års erfarenhet av design inom Data & Analys
Erfarenhet som utvecklare inom Data & Analysområdet
Erfarenhet av Data Governance, datakataloger, samt kunskap om regelverk och cybersäkerhet.
Erfarenhet av cloud- och on-prem-lösningar
Kunskap och erfarenhet av Microsofts lösningar inom området
Erfarenhet av olika dataarkitekturer som Data Mesh och Data fabric etc.



Det är meriterande om du har:


Erfarenhet av plattformar och tillämpningar inom Data & Analys
Arbetat i motsvarande roll i en större organisation (mer än 2000 anställda)
Erfarenhet av att arbeta i komplexa IT miljöer under transformation
Erfarenhet av förändringsresor mot en datadriven organisation
Praktisk erfarenhet av Generativ AI



Vårt koncernspråk är svenska vilket ställer krav på att du talar och skriver svenska obehindrat.

Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.

Startdatum enligt överenskommelse.

Det här erbjuder vi dig

På trafikförvaltningen har du möjlighet att växa och utvecklas för ett helt yrkesliv. Här kan du vara expert och fokusera på ditt sakområde. Samtidigt som du jobbar i ett lag och i en organisation med stor bredd. Det finns stora möjligheter att röra sig mellan olika roller och uppgifter. Du har utrymme att forma din egen karriärväg och stärka både din personliga och professionella utveckling i en spännande och varierad miljö!

Vi är en välkomnande och öppen arbetsplats där vi stöttar och hjälper varandra. Vi vet att nyckeln för att vi ska klara vårt uppdrag – är medarbetare som trivs, mår bra och kan utvecklas på jobbet. Därför lägger vi stor vikt vid att säkerställa hållbarhet i vårt arbetssätt, bland annat genom att erbjuda flexibilitet i vardagen och hybridarbete när möjlighet finns.

Årligen erbjuds hälsoundersökning och friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr. Hälsospåret, vår friskvårdssatsning, innehåller en rad olika hälsofrämjande aktiviteter. SL-kort är en annan uppskattad förmån hos oss. Läs mer om våra förmåner här.

Information och ansökan

I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Experis. Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsult Carina Eyoma, carina.eyoma@se.experis.com, 073–0862275. Vi använder tester för att säkra objektiva bedömningar. Ansökan sker via vår hemsida, vi har inte möjlighet att ta emot ansökningar via e-post. Endast CV önskas.

Sista ansökningsdag är 2024-09-16. Ansök redan i dag eftersom intervjuer sker löpande. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Webb och sociala medier

För mer information om hur det är att jobba hos oss, besök vår karriärsida www.regionstockholm.se/tfjobb. Du hittar oss också på Linkedin.

Vi är stolta samhällsutvecklare. Med kompetens och engagemang tar vi Stockholm och kollektivtrafiken framåt. Vi ansvarar för SL, Waxholmsbolaget, Färdtjänsten och Spårvägsmuseet och tillsammans utvecklar vi en trygg, attraktiv och tillgänglig kollektivtrafik för nära 900 000 resenärer. Följ med oss på resan!

Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We know it, you know it. Most companies ramble on about purpose and making the world a better place. And pretty often it feels a bit… well, forced. But we’d like to think that our story is special for real.




Our founders, Shadi Bitar and Ninos Malki, came to Sweden from Syria when they were kids. Books became their compass, guiding them through the maze of life, and helping them shape their destinies in a new world.




Their dream was bold: What if they could unlock the world of books for everyone, making knowledge and inspiration accessible to all? Fast forward a few years, and the tale of Nextory was born.




At Nextory, we've crafted a revolutionary monthly subscription that empowers our users to devour books like never before, be it through reading or listening. It's not just a product; it's a passport to endless adventure and enlightenment.




And now, we're on a quest to find a Data Engineer, someone as passionate as we are about making the world a happier place and enriching lives through the world of reading. Join our extraordinary team, and let's script a future where every day is a chapter of discovery, and every book is a key to a richer life.




WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING

As a Data Engineer at Nextory you will work with keeping and developing the data drivenness of Nextotry throughout the organization. With a curious, innovative and analytical mindset and tech-savvy approach you will fuel our data-driven teams.




Together with the team you will be responsible for data services which means, data warehousing, ML/AI, data quality and enabling data insights. You will build and run data pipelines, data warehouses, data frameworks and leverage ML/AI. We believe that you enjoy working autonomously in close collaboration with the cross-functional teams and other stakeholders.




You will be a part of an amazing team and be at the core of understanding a consumer subscription service - always with the continuous aspiration to increase reading! The position is based in Stockholm and you report to our COO.




WHO YOU ARE

We believe that you are currently working in a similar role at a fast-moving company. We believe that you would like to develop a thorough understanding of how consumers use our service and be part of delivering key insights. By using various development techniques, you will keep us in the forefront of creating the best customer experience as well as providing a great self-service data platform. We believe that you take pride in structuring, integrating and transforming data on a daily basis - you believe that data quality is key!

If you have ambitions (or experience!) of working with areas like ML and AI we would love to give you a platform to show your practice! You thrive working in a dynamic and unpretentious environment where you take great responsibility for our product and your team!




SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

• We believe you have, for the field, relevant educational background

• We believe you have around 4 years of experience from working within the field

• We believe that you are an expert in SQL and have worked with Java, Python and/or similar languages

• We believe that you have experience with cloud infrastructure (Azure, AWS, GCP) and cloud data warehousing, preferably BigQuery or equivalent

• We believe that you have experience working with pipelines and data integration solutions with an ELT approach

• We believe that you have experience in operating, maintaining and ensuring quality of production grade software




We are looking forward to your application which should include a CV or LinkedIn profile.

Show more

You will build and run data pipelines, data warehouses, data frameworks and leverage ML/AI. We believe that you enjoy working autonomously in close collaboration with the cross-functional teams and other stakeholders.


You will be a part of an amazing team and be at the core of understanding a consumer subscription service - always with the continuous aspiration to increase reading! The position is based in Stockholm and you report to our COO.


WHO YOU ARE

We believe that you are currently working in a similar role at a fast-moving company. We believe that you would like to develop a thorough understanding of how consumers use our service and be part of delivering key insights. By using various development techniques, you will keep us in the forefront of creating the best customer experience as well as providing a great self-service data platform. We believe that you take pride in structuring, integrating and transforming data on a daily basis - you believe that data quality is key!

If you have ambitions (or experience!) of working with areas like ML and AI we would love to give you a platform to show your practice! You thrive working in a dynamic and unpretentious environment where you take great responsibility for our product and your team!


SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

• We believe you have, for the field, relevant educational background

• We believe you have around 4 years of experience from working within the field

• We believe that you are an expert in SQL and have worked with Java, Python and/or similar languages

• We believe that you have experience with cloud infrastructure (Azure, AWS, GCP) and cloud data warehousing, preferably BigQuery or equivalent

• We believe that you have experience working with pipelines and data integration solutions with an ELT approach

• We believe that you have experience in operating, maintaining and ensuring quality of production grade software


We are looking forward to your application which should include a CV or LinkedIn profile.

Title: BI & Analytics Developer
Description:
Our talented Data & AI team is made up of globally recognized experts and there's room for more analytical, innovative, client-driven data professionals! If you're passionate about helping clients make better data-driven decisions to tackle their most complex business issues, let's talk. Take your skills to a new level and launch a career where you can truly do what matters.

Come join us

If you’re passionate about helping clients make better data-driven decisions to tackle their most complex business issues, let’s talk. Take your skills to a new level and launch a career where you can truly do what matters.

Skills And Experiences


You have extensive experience in database development mainly in SQL and working knowledge from T-SQL
Knowledge of Power BI to enhance better data visualizations to the clients
You have some experience in ETL tools and tabular/in-memory databases
You have experience in analytical applications and dimensional data modelling
You are experienced in both Azure and on-prem Microsoft platforms you are comfortable with DevOps
You have worked with solution development (and design) either in an in-house role or as a consultant
You speak fluently Swedish and English


About You

Characteristics that can spell success for this role:


Collaborative, curious, client-centric
Resilient, adaptable, flexible
Passionate about tech


What You'll Do

As a BI and Analytics Developer you will:


Translate business requirements to technical solutions leveraging strong business acumen
Work with a team maintaining and developing an end-to-end enterprise data warehouse including integrations, data modelling, analysis tools and automated reports
Work closely with the customer where mostly the solutions that the team is responsible for are business critical
Take ownership of your own development tasks while collaborating with your team members
You'll be working occasionally with Application Management, we work in a DevOps setup, mixing development and operations
Work with and be specialized in Microsoft tools


Learn more

Do you recognize yourself in this vacancy and would you like to meet us? Then apply today, we can't wait to hear from you! Even if you don't feel a complete match for this role, we would encourage you still to apply! We are constantly looking for new team members to join our growing Data & AI team.

Enjoy your career

Some Of The Best Things About Working At Avanade


People-first culture that supports innovation and encourages people to move forward
Knowledge development is our focus, and we ensure this both by offering formal training opportunities as well as informal evenings where peers share their knowledge
With your passion, you can use the latest Microsoft technology to make a difference for our customers in the Enterprise market
We have a strong focus on the career and development opportunities of all our people. Everyone has a career adviser who will work with you to create a plan and guide you in choosing from the many training opportunities we offer
Working in a hybrid/flexible model


A great place to work

As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you'll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and our communities. You'll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, but to also lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It's all here, so take a closer look! We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
***URGENT REQUIREMENT - STOCKHOLM BASED***




Good Evening Network,




I am currently searching urgently for a Azure Data Engineer to come and drive a global, greenfield initiative. This is to work for a global leading technology organisation with offices mainly across the whole of Sweden.




The ideal professional must have experience in:

- Azure Data

- Azure Data Factory

- Financial Experiences

- Must be based around Stockholm




This is a 3-5 year program with an 6-12 month contract.

Title: Graduate and Junior Management Consulting Analysts to Accenture Consulting
Description:
Are you a recent graduate or about to graduate from university? Do you see a future career in Consulting? Bring your talent and passion to Accenture and help us deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity! Take this opportunity as a Consulting Analyst to develop your skills and build an extraordinary career!

About Accenture And Consulting 

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions — underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network — Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With more than 710,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives.

Through deep industry expertise, analytics and insights, we empower clients to survive and thrive in the new, the now and the unknown. To stay agile in a world dominated by change, the C-suite must keep the core business running while simultaneously identifying and investing in the new. Accenture Consulting enables leaders to act quickly and confidently as they pivot to the future. Known for our ability to execute at speed, we help clients determine clear, actionable paths to competitive agility by bringing them new thinking on business and technology. 

About Our Functions And Industries

Accenture Consulting consists of a wide range of business functions and industry groups. Main functions for Consulting Analysts include Finance, Supply Chain, HR and Technology. Primary industries include Retail, Consumer Goods & Services, Banking, Insurance, Capital Markets, Comms & Media, Utilities, Industrial Equipment, Automotive, Health. Read more about our business functions and industries here.   

 

Consulting Analysts within Industry and Functional Consulting Industry and Functional Consulting leverage industry and functional expertise and data-driven insights to advise, design and implement transformational solutions to reimagine business functions and create new business models for our clients. As a Consulting Analyst, you’ll work as part of a project team to build enduring, trust-based relationships and work with clients to identify market opportunities that transform their businesses across people, process and technology. You’ll get early responsibility and build your skills and expertise through interesting and challenging work.

Work you will do as a Consulting Analyst



Apply insights and knowledge to help clients navigate in a changing business environment, optimize their business and leverage their talent 


Help clients identify and unlock value in their business using benchmarks, interviews and workshops  


Design and implement end-to-end business processes to transform our clients’ business  


Define client needs by identifying and documenting business requirements, before agreeing what needs to change and which opportunities to take advantage of 


Define how the client will evolve to the future state— i.e., the impact of the changes and the steps we will take to help the leaders, employees, customers and others adapt quickly to new ways of working. 



 

What’s in it for you:  



Great development opportunities to start building your professional career 


Extensive training to develop your business acumen, technical and professional skills including on-the-job learning and formal training  


Access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization - including methodology, knowledge databases, expert networks and benchmarks 


A dedicated mentor to guide you in your career at Accenture 


Inspiring colleagues to support you in your daily work 


Over time, you will also have leadership responsibilities and lead teams



Job Qualifications

Who we are looking for:  



You have a master's degree and / or will receive your degree within one year of applying 


You can start at Accenture in late summer/autumn 2025  


You have proven strong academic results in a relevant field 


You are an analytical problem-solver with strong business acumen 


You are ambitious, driven, solution-oriented and eager to start your career in an advisory role 


You have excellent written and oral presentation skills


You are fluent in English. Swedish is beneficial but not required 



Office and start

We are looking for graduates to join our offices in Stockholm, Gothenburg and Malmö in late summer/autumn 2025. Mobility and flexibility to either work physically at an office (client or Accenture), or in a virtual “home office” is expected. This requires you to both have a high degree of flexibility for travelling to our clients or working with international teams virtually. The application and interview process 

Send your application today through our application portal and attach:



CV


Cover Letter


University Transcripts/grades (including GPA in a 5 grade scale)



Upload all files under "Upload Resume/CV". Please note that all of these documents are required for a complete application. Only complete applications are reviewed.  

Please indicate which office(s) you are applying to in your application.   The screening and selection process is ongoing. If your application proceeds to the next step, you will receive an invitation to two tests that aim to measure your analytical ability.  We look forward to receiving your application!  Equal is greater than - Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from a diverse group of backgrounds related to gender, age, ethnicity, culture, race, religion and belief, disability, nationality, sexual orientation and gender identity. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values, providing an environment where everyone brings distinct experience, talent and culture to their work. We invite you to be part of this diversity! 


Show more

Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values, providing an environment where everyone brings distinct experience, talent and culture to their work.
